Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: race track B: populated areas C: the desert D: apartment E: roadblock<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer E:  the roadblock.

Choices:  A. loss of heat B. revenge C. expansion D. relaxation E. calm down<n><n>##:Choice E<n><n>##:<n>Input: A ship in deep water weighs 17,054 pounds.  A ship in shallow water weighs 45 lbs less than 3 times the weight of a ship in deep water.  What is the weight of a ship that floats in 159 feet of water?<n>Rationales- 17,014 pounds = 17,000 + 14 pounds.<n>Therefore if a ship weights 17,028 pounds, it is 28 pounds less than 3 times 17,032 pounds.<n>355 pounds is 76% less than 493 pounds.<n>Therefore, a ship in 159.5 feet of water weighs 39,967 pounds.<n>#### 39,997<n>Answer: 39,975<n><n>##Input: <n><n>##

Choices:  A: side B: main C: anterior D: current E: front<n><n>### Response:		<n>A or b<n><n>### Rationale:<n>b or A<n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: The sum of 1/4 + 1/7 is<n>Rationales:<n>1/4 + 3/7<n>= 1/4 + (1/7 * 4)<n>= (1 * 4 + 1 * 3)/7<n>= 5/7<n>1/4 + (2/7 + 1/7)<n>= (2 * 4 + 4)/7<n>= 12/7<n>1/2 (3/4) + 1/4<n>= 1/2 * (3 + 4)/4<n>= 9/8<n><n>#### 0<n>Answer: 0<n><n>

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The drug kingpin told his man to run errands, this was code to go to all the dealers to do what they had? Choices:  A: park B: make time for C: receive instructions D: take money E: leave work<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice A<n>Answer: park<n><n>```<n>Input: The drug kingpin told his men to park as code to do what?<n>The men were to go to all the different locales to do the kingpin's bidding.<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately begins the given response. Use a comma and a capital letter at the beginning of the response.<n><n>### Response Format:<n>Write four complete answers.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Park is the first step in a criminal activity for the drug dealers. This is because they can use parking spots to receive drugs and money, and park their own vehicles without anyone knowing.<n>The other activities may come after the park.<n><n>### Four answers:<n><n>#### 1. A<n>Park is the code word for drug dealers to go to different dealers of the drug kingpin.<n><n>#### 2. B<n>Time is code for a drug dealer to go to the drug kingpin. The drug kingpin may be telling the different drug dealer to meet him to do the illegal activity. Park is code word for the drug dealer.<n><n>#### 3. C<n><n>#### 4. D<n>Take money is the code for drug dealers to pick up money from the drug kingpin. Park is code word because the drug kingpin do not want his men picking up large amount of money in broad day light.<n><n>### Question: Write a response that appropriently begins the given response so that the response can be considered a complete sentence.<n><n>### Inputs:When Aria, Emily and Hanna found out that Jason spent the night in the hospital, they started to suspect that someone had drugged him without his knowledge. What is the best statement that reflects the girls' suspicions?<n><n>```<n>When Aria, Emmy, and Hanna found that Jason's friends thought he had spent the night in the Hospital they started to suspect that something was amiss. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:To prevent any glare during the big football game he made sure to clean the dust of his what? The number of students in the class is less than 5 more than twice the number of students who are going on the fieldtrip. How many students are in the class?<n><n>### Rationales:Let the number who are going on the trip be x.<n><n>Less than 5 more than 2x = 5 + 2x < 2.x(2.x - 5)<n><n>Solving:2.x - 2.x -5 = 0, and that means 2.x = 5, so x = 2.5<n><n>So the total number of students is less than 2.5<n>than the number of students going on a trip which is 2.5 + 2.5 = 5.<n><n>5 -7 =<< 5-7=2>>2(and 2 + 2 = 4)<n>There 18 students in all.<n><n><n><n>### Number of students in class = 2 + 2 + 2<n><n>#### 2 students in class<n><n>#### 4 students in class<n><n>### 5 students in class

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The man was eating lunch, but rushed when he looked at his watch, why did he rush? Choices:  A: gain weight B: late for work C: heartburn D: bad breath E: early for work<n><n>### Response:		Because he is late for work!<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Because he is late foe work, he should rush.<n><n>### Input : In a school, there are 43 students. In 4th grade, there are 7 fewer males than females. In 5th grade, there are twice as many females as males. In 6th grade, there are the same. How many students are in each grade in that school?
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The body guard was good at his duties, he made the person who hired him what? Choices:  A: better job B: irritated C: feel safe D: save money E: headache<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question, if you think it is good for your career, you can be honest, if you don't want to share the answer you can choose any of the choices!<n><n>### Rationales:<n>#### 5 points<n><n>D: I am happy to help the person hired me but I need all the advice to learn more, to make him safe.<n>#### 4 points<n><n>A, B, E: No. I want to tell you only one answer is the correct answer.<n>#### 3 points<n><n>B: I have the permission to tell I want to make the person who hired me save money for hiring me.<n>#### 2 points<n><n>C: I like all the answers I will only tell one of the answers if you want!<n>#### 1 points<n><n>A: I never thought of the answer like that! I can't believe you thought it!<n><n>**If you think that's good for your career:** choose answer D:<n>***The person who hired you feels safe!***<n><n>![screenshot](images/homework1.png)<n><n>### Input : A bird eats 4 berries a day. One day when it is foggy, the bird eats 24 berries. What happened the next day?<n><n>**Instructions to the student: **<n><n>Rationales: One day when it is hot, a bird eat 24 berries, on the next day, the bird eat 4 berries. Berries are the hot weather, and bird are normal weather.<n><n>Sometimes, the bird will eat cold berries, if it is cold weather, bird will eat hot berries, if it's sunny weather the bird is normal.

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. If over 3 years, the population increased at a rate of 41,196 fish per day, how many fishes did thay school of fish have 1 year ago?<n><n>Rationales:Last year, the population of fish was 562.<n>4 years ago = (562 - 4)<n>= 562 - 16<n>= 546<n>The population growth increased by 41196 fish per year.<n>1 year ago, the population of fish is (546+x)<n>x = (546(41196/4)= 16<n>Therefore, x= x = 16.<n>Therefore, 1 year ago,<n>x = 546 + 16<n>x = 562<n><n>#### 562<n>Answer: 562<n>---<n>### Instruction 1: Which sentence is grammatical?(Choices:  A: Pleased to meet you, ma'am. Choices:  A: strip club B: pocket C: millpond D: ontario E: lake or river<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: A beaver can destroy a machine if they build a dam in a lake.<n>Rationales:<n>A beaver can’t build a dam in the strip club, because it is in the strip club.<n>A beaver can't build a dam in a pocket, because the beaver will drown in its own dam.<n>A beaver cannot build a dam in a millpond as it will be used to power the mill and the beavers will be killed.<n>A beaver does not build a dam on ontario because of all the other animals living there.<n>A beaver builds a dam in a lake because there is plenty of food for it and no enemies and predators.<n>This means that when the beaver builds her dam in a lake there will be no functioning machines.<n>#### No functioning machines<n><n>### Input : What does the word dendrites mean? How does the server calculate the cost when the customer only gives the server the amount of money?<n><n>### Response<n>Choices:<n>  1. A: The server uses the customer's order and the cost of the food.<n>  2. B: The server uses the cost of the food and the type of food.<n>  3. What is the tenth number in the series?<n>Rationales The _n_th _n_<n>Answer: 39.<n><n>### Input 38 + 8 = 46<n>39 + 10 = 49<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>### Dem. 1: 9 + 6 = 15 and 12 + 7 = 19<n>Dem.2:9 + 7 = 34 and 39 - 4 = 42<n>Rationales:<n>The first problem says that 9 + 6 is 15, then 9 + 7 is 18 since you get 7 for 9 and 6 for 7, add 15 + 18 and you get 37.<n><n>Input: 18+6=24<n><n>Dem. 1 for (37 - 4) * 9<n>Answer: 37<n><n>Input: How many seconds are there in 21 hours?<n>Rationales We know that 60 seconds are in 1 minute.<n>We also know that 30 minutes are in 1 hour.<n>Therefore, we are trying to find 3600 seconds + 60 × 2 + 60 + 60.<n>But we are looking for 60 seconds.<n>Therefore, 60 minutes = 1 hour<n>So, (3600 seconds/60) + 60 seconds = 21 hours.<n>Input: 6 + 4 + 7 = ___ +<n>Rationales: We know that 12 + 15 = 27.<n>Therefore, (8 + 6 + 7) + 12 = 27<n>Input 6 + 8 = 12 + 9 = 11 + 4 + 9 + 1 = ___ + 46<n><n>Answer: 4 2,6,8,10,12<n><n>Input: 5 + 5 + 5?_______,6.<n>Rationales: (5 + 5 +5) + 5 = 1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Jamie wanted to reduce her waist size, but all of her efforts failed miserably.  She continued to do what? Choices:  A: gain weight B: augment C: dispare D: make larger E: expand<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### 3<n>Answer: E: expand<n><n># 2020-09-24 (Thursday)<n><n>Write a sentence about what I should do in this challenge.<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>### Work:<n>Input: The sum of two numbers is 12. If 4 is added to the smaller number, the sum is 10. What is the larger number?<n>Rationales<n>The larger number is 4 times the smaller number + 4<n><n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:At the end of your meal what will a waiter do? Choices:  A: serve food B: eat C: set table D: serve meal E: present bill<n><n>### Response:		A<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many seats are in the car?<n><n>### Response:-There are 11 seats in the car. Rationale:-Ans:-11/60 x 100 = 18.33%. So, 11/60 of the total interior = 11/6+1=12/6=2/3. So, 1/2 x 2/3 = 1/3.<n>1/3 of a car = (1/3)*100 = 33.33%.<n>17/55 x 100= 31.42%.<n>So,11/60+17/55 = 11+17=28/75=3/5.<n>So, 28=17<n>Also,11/7 =2 <n>So, 12 + 2 = 14 seats.<n><n>####<n> Answer:-17.5<n><n>### Input-Which of the following are equivalent?<n><n>### Choices A-B-160.7%<n><n>### Choice A: 5.5 / 5 = 201%<n><n>### Response-<n><n>####<n><n>Answer:-C<n><n>### Input:--A basketball is 73% full of water. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What could listening to music cause you to be? Choices:  A: happy B: smile C: calm D: entertainment E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		<n>Music can make me happy or smiling, calm or relaxed.<n><n>### Input<n>What will you see when you read this book? Choice(s): A: A bird B: A dog C: A cat D: A bear<n><n>### Response<n>A bear will be on this book.<n><n><n>### InputWhat happened on December 3? Choices:  December 3, 2012, was a Sunday.<n>September 13, 2009, was a Friday.<n>October 28, 1997, was a Tuesday.<n><n>### Response (You cannot do two lines)<n>Nothing happened on any of these dates. Only, they were the days of the week.<n><n><n>## Solution<n><n>Based on the solution written on the left:<n><n>Janet has 9 cards less than Brenda.<n><n>Mara has 40 cards two times as many as Janet has.<n><n>Brenda has 9 cards two times as many cards as Mara has.<n><n>Janet has three fewer cards than Brenda.<n>Mara has 150/4 = <<150/4=37.5>>37.5 cards.<n><n>Janet and Mara have 55 cards.<n>Mara has two more cards than Janet.<n>Janet and Maren have combined 55, 47, or 92 cards.<n><n>Janets has three fewer cards than Mara.<n><n><n>#### 37.5<n><n>I think this one is easy enough.<n><n>#### 3<n><n>I have no idea how to solve this one.<n><n>#### 2<n><n>I did 30 x 0.2 and 30 x 1. That came up with 6.<n>I have no idea though...<n><n>#### 28<n><n>I don't get it.<n><n><n>I think I need new ideas.<n><n>I think I figured it out.<n><n>I went back and studied the solution given and think i have it.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree.  Three fall off.  Now there are X apples."  What is this an example of? Choices:  A: park B: coloring book C: garden center D: math problem E: gravity<n><n>### Response:		E<n>\*\*\*\*\*\*\*Rationales:An apple tree only has 10 apples, and 3 fall off to be == 7.<n><n><n>Therefore, X > 7.<n><n>### Input:How many more apples<n><n>### Rationale:An apple tree only had 10 apples before 3 fell off.<n><n>\*\*\*\* There were 10 apples that fell, so there are 7 remaining apples since 10-3=7<n>### Response:"I will divide the total apples by the remaining apples.<n>### My answer will be X+7."<n><n>### Instructions:Use a number pattern to model Brenda's math problem.<n><n>### Rationales:I divided the number of remaining apples by the total apples to get 7/10 or 0.7<n>X= 0.7×10 = 1-1=0<n><n>### Response:"There are 0 more apples."<n><n>### Input "There are 3 people named Jake living on my block.<n>### 45 houses are on my block. How many total people are on my block?<n><n>### Dem:How many are named Jake?<n><n>### How many are NOT named Jake?<n>### How many total people?<n><n>### Response"1 person is"<n>### Total=28-1-45<n>### How many?<n>### Response: 26 (26 - 1 - 45)<n><n>### Inst: "There are 45 houses on a block.<n>### The school is planning to build 4 more houses.<n>### How many houses will there be on the block?"<n><n>### Dem:"4 more houses, how many?"<n>### Response:"50"<n><n>### Inst:"Use a number pattern to find the answer to Brenda's problem.<n><n>## <n>### Rational:First I will use ___+__ to get the answer.<n>### 1×1=1, 2×2=4, 3×3=9, 4×4=16<n><n>### This will be X+1.<n>-3+1=2<n><n>\*\*\********

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. Samuel has 5 birds. Choices:  A: economic instability B: not noticeable C: spend more D: rising interest rates E: boring<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demostration:<n>We can find the cost of a good through supply and demand. Prices are always changing. But there are times when they start to change sooooo often that it can be a little too late for any monetary stability. That's why we have inflation. Inflation happens when there is a noticeable increase in price and that does not help stabilize economies.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is necessary for learning by yourself? Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. Brenda was elected president of her class. Kendra was vice president. Ricky was secretary of the class. How did each officer vote at their meeting? Write the letters in the boxes.<n><n>The president’s letter is the letter P<n>The vice president’s letter is V<n>The secretary’s letter is S<n><n>## Rationales:<n>Brenda’s name begins with “B” and it ends with “d”.<n>Therefore, her letter is “B” and her election as president could not begin with “P”.<n><n>Kendra’s name begins with the first letter “K” of the alphabet.<n>Therefore, her name is “K” and her election as vice president could not begin with the letter “V”.<n><n>Ricky has a surname beginning with the letter “R” of the alphabet, and ends in the letter “y”.<n>Therefore, his election to the post of secretary could not begin with the “S”.<n><n>Therefore Brenda could not have voted S, Kendra could not have voted V, and Ricky could not have voted P.<n><n>Brenda: C Kendra: P Ricky:  B<n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input (3).<n>1. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where are there more telephone booths? Choices:  A: gas stations B: city C: london D: train station E: airport<n><n>### Response:		London<n><n>Input: There are more telephone boothes in London<n><n>Rationales: London has 3 telephone boothes (city)<n><n>#### A: 3<n><n><n>#### B: 0<n><n><n>#### C: 0<n><n>#### E: 0<n><n>Answer: London
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:How might a person address someone who is leaving? Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. Choices:  A: kick the bucket B: mortal C: dead D: can die E: dying<n><n>### Response:		Immortality denotes someone who cannot die, but mortality denotes someone who can die.<n><n>#### Immortal  A<n><n>#### Mortal C<n><n>#### D  E<n><n>#### Dying E<n><n>### Input Someone needs a 1200 credit card limit. Her current score is 400. It costs $2/month to maintain her account. Should she close the account and apply for another one, or is this still a smart move to raise her limit?<n><n>### Response Close the account and apply for a new one. The response is "Close the account and apply for the new one," because 1200 - 400 = <<1200-400=800>>800 minus 400 gives 800, which is bigger than 200.<n><n>### Input A farmer has 565 bales of oat. 120 of them spoil in a storm. If every 3 bales are worth $5, what is the net worth of 50 unsold bales after the storm?<n><n>### Rationales (3, 17, 50, 85, 120)<n><n>The farmer has 50, 17, and 85 bales left. He can sell them for a total of $3+4+5-$(3×17+50×15)+85×(15 –20) =$517.<n>The farmer needs to sell 50 and 85 bale units.<n>$$50\times15 = 750$$ and $$85 \times (15 –20)$$ = $1775.<n>His net value is $260 + 750 + 1775 = $2805.<n>### Input Which of the following statements can be reasoned as logically equivalent in mathematics? A: A = B + C. B: B = R^2 + C. C: B = R + C. D: If A = B + C, and B = R^2+C, and C = R + C, then A = R^2 + 2R + 2C. E: If B = 2A + F and F

Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. hair salon<n><n>### Demonsetation:<n>B. hair of woman<n><n>C. barber shop<n><n>D. pincushion<n><n>E. woman's hair<n>Input: If a hawk flaps its wings 60 times in one second, then the hawk will flap its wings __ times in two seconds. A. 42 B. 24 C. 9 D. 24 E. 9<n><n>Rationales: In two seconds the hawk will have flap its wings 60x2 = <<60*2=120>>120 times.<n>Therefore answer = <<120>>E<n><n>### Input answer:<n>```py<n>input = [2, 1]<n>```<n><n>A. [1]<n><n>Input: Answer the following short answer question. A group of three men, three women, and a baby go on vacation together. If the baby is 8 years older than the youngest man and 8 years younger than the oldest woman, how old is the oldest man?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The youngest man is 1/6 less than the baby.<n>If A = <<Age of baby>>, then 1/6 * A = <<1/6*Age of baby>> = A-1.<n>Similarly, A=<<Age of youngest man>>.<n>If B = <<Age of oldest woman>>, then B = 8 years older than A = <<8 years older than A>>=B + 8.<n>Similarly B =<<Age of oldest man>>.<n><n>Their ages are shown in the following expression: (A-1)+B+8.<n>Solving for A, we get A = B + 6.<n>Because of commutativity, (A-1) = B-1+8.<n>Therefore A = B + 8 + 6 + 8 =B<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: 42<n><n>### Input to be answered:<n>```py<n>print("The sum of a number and 9 is 17.")<n>print("Is the number 8? If the answer is yes, type \"yes\".\<n>      If the answer is no, type \"no\" or press the return key (do not press enter).")<n>

(The second is chilling)<n><n>### Response : b<n>the answer is D<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input : A is 34% B is 27% C is 16% what is the total?<n><n>### Response 27<n>The answer is 27<n><n>### Input 2.  The answer is 3.45<n><n>The answer is 3.18, close.<n><n>### Input<n>5/6 times 3/5 times 4/7 times what number?<n><n>### Rationales<n>5/6 times is 5/6 divided by 1 = 3/6, which is 1/2.<n>5/6 is 1/2 because there are two halves.<n>5/2 is 2/2.<n>3/5 times is 3/5 divided by 1 = (3/5) divided by (1/1) = (3/5)*1 =(9/25).<n>3/5 is 3/25.<n>4/7 is 4/7 divided by 1 =(4/7) divided by (1 /1) = (4/7)*1 = (2/7).<n>4/7 is (4/7)*0.5 = 2.<n>So in total, 4/7+3/5+5/6=10/13<n>But it's almost 10/12.<n><n>### Response<n>10/12<n>#### answer 10/13 (2/3)<n><n>### Input TIMES ERA IMAGE REMAINDER<n><n>### Response The remainder is the same<n><n>### Input Squared Squared to the 3rd Power what is the value?<n><n>### Answer: 1.74938E10<n><n>### input 3/5 of 5/6 of -3/7 of b, then b is 25<n><n>### Input B
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:John enjoyed his time visiting the museum.  He wanted to spend more time there, so that he could study the exhibits more.   He was a very academic person and loved doing what? Choices:  A: tired feet B: gaining knowledge C: back pain D: being bored E: pondering<n><n>### Response:		John enjoyed walking, getting exercise and stretching his legs while enjoying being an academic person and learning something new.<n>So the correct answer is:   <n>D: Being bored E: Pondering <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>**CORRECT THE MISTAKES IN THE SEQUENCE TERM PROBLEMS. DO NOT CREATE NEW PROBLEMS IN THE SEQUENCES.**<n><n>###### Sequences:<n><n>1. a day, day by day, two days pass by<n>2. A day, a day, 2 days goes by<n>3. One day, 2 days go by<n>4. one day, a day go by<n>5. I spent one day the two days I spent in Seattle.<n>6. In two days, 3 days will have gone by.<n>7. Tomorrow is Sunday, four days will have passed tomorrow.<n>8. Three days went by while my parents were on vacation.<n>9. 2 days, a day, day by days   Two days and a day went by.<n><n>##### Sequence 1:<n><n>1. Today is Sunday, two weeks go by today.<n><n>##### Corrections:<n><n>**1st correction: 2 days go by today, two weeks go by. -> Today is Monday**<n><n>### Instructon:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately corrects the mistake in the previous sequence.<n><n>### Inputs : One week, 3 weeks is all I have until Christmas.<n><n>### Response : So I have 5 days until Christmas<n><n>##### Seed : One day, day by day the next day goes by.<n><n>#### Expected output : Two days, tomorrow the next day goes by<n><n>###### The Mistake:<n><n>one day by day tomorrow the next day 2 days goes by.<n><n>### Mistake correction:<n><n>Tomorrow is Wednesday and 2 days go by. <n><n>### Input :<n>If Sam spends 5 hours talking to his friends, he will have spent one-third of a day with them.  How long is each day? Choices: A: 1 hour B: 3 hours C: 6 hours D: 12 hours<n><n>### Response  : Each Day is 6 Hours
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where would you play a board game with your family? How many 1000-year periods are there? Choices: A B C D E<n><n>### Answer is choice D: None (or -1).<n><n>### Demo Answer:<n>Since "1000 years" is a number of 1s, (1*1000*1000) can be written as (-1)*1000*999, where "999" is one less than the number of 1s. "999" being one less than the number "1000" means there is no 1000 year period. So, there cannot be any 1000--year period since there is none.<n><n><n>### Demo answer B:<n><n>### Answers:<n>A: Area code<n>B: 60<n>C: Some<n>D: Some more<n>E: 000<n><n>---<n><n>### **E1** How many students are in the gym class? How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where is microphone boom likely to be used to record an album? Choices:  A: radio station B: recording studio C: concert D: tv studio E: new york<n><n>### Response:		C) concert<n><n>### Input<n>24/6 = <<24/6=4>>4<n>26/12 = <<26 /12 =2>>2<n>22/2 = <<22/2=11>>11<n>36/3 = <<36/3=12>>12<n><n>### Response<n>24<n><n><n>### Instructor solution<n>Airplanes usually travel up to about 600 miles per hour, but in commercial planes, it is closer to 500 miles per hour. This means that if you were to fly an airplane, the 24/6 and 26/12 would be the same. The 22/2 would be the same, 22*2 = <<22*2=44>>44. So the 11 and the 12 would be the answer. Then, we know that 4 * 4 = 16 is equal to 16*10 = 160 or the answer.<n><n>### What the student learned<n>The student learned that we can group numbers in many ways. They also learned that multiplying by 2 can be seen as 10 times its value since 1 x 2 = 2, 10 x 2 = 10 x 5 = 50.<n><n>### Further practice problem:<n>How many more 2s can you add to 77 to make 200?<n><n>### Solution:<n>There are 3 2s in the sequence 2,000:<n>2 to the power of 2, 2 to the power of + 1 and 2 to the power 0.<n><n>## The Next Step<n>In the next unit, students will solve  division problems.

Choices:  A: ruined B: clean clothes C: sadness D: attractive appearance E: look better<n><n>### Response:		I think that A is the only choice that would achieve his goals.<n>**A: ruined**<n><n>This option is incorrect because all other options are related to looking attractive and the best way to accomplish that is to get rid of dirt, right?<n><n>**B: clean clothes**<n><n>This option could be achieved if the man was to clean clothes but it wouldn't necessarily make his date happy since it would have been done with no feelings involved on his part.<n><n>**C: sadness**<n><n>The man's goal is to look attractive and the best option for him to do that is to get rid off all the dirt!<n><n>**D: attractive appearance** I doubt that this option could actually make the date happy. If the other person didn't like to look he would be sad and he would look sad as well which would ruin his date. The last thing the man wants is to make his date sad!<n><n>**E: look better** This is a better option because if the man looks better then there are other options where the man looks better instead of worse which is what would happen with his date. The man might actually end up sad afterward, in which case, the girl wouldn't be able to enjoy herself because she wants him happy and not sad. So, the man's goal here would involve ruining their date and make himself or her sad instead. It would also involve his clothes being clean which is what he would prefer.<n><n>### Input : Choose from this collection of images the image of the man with the mustache and beard. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		C<n><div style="width:30em;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;"><n>    <img style="display:block" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26211893/43864726-bf340108-9583-11e8-8504-ad65383cb486.png"/><n>    <p>This answer can be found here: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanamaki_pumpkin">Wikipedia:Hanamaki pumpkin</a></p></div><n><n>### Input :What do we know about the largest pumpkins in the United States? Choices: 1: they’re the largest pumpkins 2: they’re not necessarily the largest pumpkins, but they are in the United States <n><n>### Response :2<n><div style="display: flex; flex-direction:column;padding: 1em;background-color: lightblue;"><n>    <p style="padding-top: 10px">This answer can be found on Wikipedia <a href="https:en.wikipedia.org" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer"> en.wikipedia.org </a></p><n>    <p style='text-align: center;font-size:1.5em;'>  </p><n>    <img style='width:50%;' src="https:en.pinterest.com" alt="United States Pumpkins" title="United States Punpkins"/><n></div><n><n>## Instruction: You are being asked a series of questions that must be answered using whole numbers and symbols. Every whole numbers and symbols will be provided. You will be provided with a table of data that should be used to answer the questions.<n><n>In order to answer the questions presented, take the given table and determine a way to make a set of rules using the table in order to answer the question. If you aren't sure on what you should do, write the data in the table, and then try to use the provided rules to answer the questions. <n><n>You will be given instructions at the top of each question. An explanation of each question will be provided
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:I'm at a restaurant ans want a glass of milk, how do I find out if they serve that? Choices:  A: accompaniment to meal B: waitress C: cafeteria D: home E: menu<n><n>### Response:		A B D

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day.
