Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. At the end of the summer, they have 3/4 of a gallon of sand and are on their way to get 1/2 gallon of ice creama sandwiches. If there are 4/24 sandwitches in a gallon of sand, how many sandwiches do they need?<n>Rationales. B. If the family has 1/2 gallons of ice cream sandwitches, they have 1/2 x 4/24 = <<1/2*4/24=1>>1 sandwich in a gallon.<n>At the end of the summer they have 1/(1/4 x 1/6) sandwiches which is the same as (1/4) (1/6) = <<1/4*1/6=1/24>>1/24.<n>Therefore, (1/24) * (1/6) is equal to (1/24 x 1/4).<n>When we move each factor to the other side:<n>```<n>    (1/24)*(1/6) = (1/24)(1/4)<n>```<n><n>If they have `(1/24)(3/4)` sandwitches they

Choices:  A: conference B: theater C: building D: floor E: church<n><n>### Response:		If a single chair is represented by `1` and two chairs are represented by `2`, then the `rows` will be `1`, `columns` will be `12`, and `diagonals` will be `24`. This is why the answer is `E`, since it's the same as `4`, `8`, `16`, and `32` combined.<n><n>### Rationales: The floor of the room is `64`, which is 24 × 2. There are 24 pairs of columns as well. Therefore, there are 2 `rows × 24 columns × 24 diagonals = 288` seats in the room<n><n>### Inputs and Outputs<n><n><table><n><tr><n><th>Input</th><n><th>Output</th><n><tr>1. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy treats for kids over a counter? Choices:  A: candy store B: butcher shop C: kitchen D: auto repair shop E: post office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* If the choice is A: Butcher shop<n><n>```<n>How:<n>If the store the kids buy their treats at is a butcher shop, they likely buy their treats in the kitchen.  They likely make the treats they buy from the eggs and milk they buy from the butcher shop.  Thus, the answer is A.<n>```<n><n>* If the response is not A, then the store the kids would buy their treats is another one, so:<n><n>```<n>How to ask for any other  answer that is not A:<n>How:<n>You should ask: Which other store do the treats from?<n><n>Asking:<n>Why this works:<n>You are trying to find out if the other store from the given answer is A.  A is definitely not one of the other answers because it is the answer to the question and it will never be an answer to the question itself.  Thus, the other answers must be other stores.<n>```<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>* If a given input is A: Butcher Shop, we need an instruction to give a proper answer or a response.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. If the number 355 is divided by 3 once again, the remainder is 23. If the number 23 is divided by 3 one more time, the remainder is 17. What is the original number?<n>Rationales1:33 = <<33>>33<n>100 = <<100>>100<n>33/100 = <<33/101>>.33<n>355/3 = <<355/3>>.54<n>355/1.5 = <<355//1.5>>23<n>17/3 = <<17/3>>5.33<n><n>#### 5.33<n>Answer: 5.3333...3 is the original number<n>

Choices:  A. tooth B. fin C. fish D. sea E. food <n><n>### Demands:B: fin<n><n>### Answer:D: serve justice<n><n>Input: 171 students, 7 teachers, and 26 parents attended a science conference. How many people attended?<n>Rationales:"26" is the lowest possible value of the quantity "Parents".<n>"7" is the lowest possible level of the quantity "Teachers".<n>"171" is the lowest possible quantity of the quantity "Students".<n>So, "7 + 171 + 26" is the value of "Total".<n><n>#### 26<n>Answer: 26<n><n>### Instructions:Solve the system of linear equations.<n><n>### Inputs:4x + (7x - 6) = -7<n><n>3x + (11x + 6) = -8<n>### Demand:(7x - 6)=0 for one variable 4x = -7 for another variable<n><n>(11x + 7) = (3x + 13)<n>### Rationales:Subtract (7x - 7) from both sides and isolate x.<n>3x - (7x - 14) = 0; 14x = 20; x = 20/14 <n><n><n>### Input:(5x - 6)(5x + 15) = 6(5x + 12)(3x + 2)<n><n>Rationales:Rewrite and combine like terms: "(5x - 6)-10*3x2" and "(5x + 13)+2*5x"<n>Rationalise (b/a)*r*r/d and (c/a)*r/d<n><n>#### Solve for x:(5x - 13 + 2*5x)3x2/(5x-6-2*5x)*(5x + 3)<n><n><n><n>### Demanda)a*b*c = (ac)+(ba)<n><n>b*c + 3<n><n>###
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		Make mistakes<n><n>### Reason: A, B, D, and E are not viable because making mistakes means that humans can repeat the same mistake. On the other hand, if humans wanted to eat, they would not have to get up and find food.<n><n>### Input 2:What would humans do on a day full of meetings and tasks? Choices: A: look forward to tomorrow. B: feel a little sick C: sleep well D: not get enough food E: get distracted<n><n>### Response 3: feel a little sick<n><n>### Reasons : Feeling a little sick means that humans are tired or need to sleep. The other choices do not lead to a lot of sleep.<n><n>### Practice:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Choose the correct answer.<n><n>### 1: How many cards do they all have if Mara has 110 +55+46 = <<150 - 33 =117>>117 cards?<n><n>### A: 40<n><n>##  B: 110<n><n>## C: 211 < 211<n>  <n>## 3:<n> <n>How many blocks did Pete walk when he got to the post office?<n><n>## A: 50 < 55<n>  <n>##  B:30 < 50 → true<n>  <n>## C: 55 < 41 → false<n>  <n>## 4:<n>Choices: Choose the correct answer from the choices.<n><n>##  A: 6<n><n>## B:33

If a chapter is read in 52 minutes, how many minutes is spent reading the book?<n>Rationales  : If a chapter is read for 52 minutes then the number of chapters should be 19/52 minutes = <<19/52=0.37>>0.37.<n>Therefore 0.37 *52 minutes = <<0.37*52=18.82>>18 minutes and 18.82 +52= <<18.82+52=70.82>>70.82 minutes are required to read the book.<n>#### 70.82<n>Answer: 70.8<n><n>### Input; The difference of two consecutive integers is 15. This sentence is from the question.<n><n>## Input:An item costs $4.50 at its regular price in the weekend sale. What is the regular price percentage of the item when the item is 20% off?<n><n>### Rationales:Since the regular price is 4.5/45 x =<<4.5/40x=11.25>>11.25 = 11% off<n><n>### Solution:0.8 x 11 - (0.9) = 0.8 x 0.75 =<n><n>### Rationale:Based on the solution, the regular price percentage is 6.8%<n><n>### Input:"We need 300 copies of ______ to fill in the blanks." - the school magazine.<n><n>### RATIONALE:<n>-"_Blank_ means _"<n><n>### Solution:: "We need _________ to fill in the blank."<n><n><n>Instruction:"We need 350 copies of the school magazine to fill in the blinks."<n><n>## Input:"You need to make some copies for the party of your class'."<n><n>### Instructions:"Please reply based on the instructions.The task instruction is "the class is going to have a party at the weekend.' Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:In war, your primary method is combat, but your goal is to do what? Choices:  A: conquer opponent B: fight enemy C: join army D: kill E: terrible<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>

The boy made 84 more pieces than the girl. If the girl made less than the boy, how many extra pieces did each make?<n><n>### Instuction: What is the difference between a 2-point word and a 3-point word? How do these two types of words impact the meaning of a sentence?<n><n>### Response<n><n>3-points words are the kind with an "e" at the end of them. 2-point words have no "e" at the word. For example, "cat," "hit," and "met," and "cat," "met," "man," and "mat" are 2-point words. "Forgive," "grieve," "lie," and "need" are 3-point words. When a 3-point words is used, it makes the sentence stronger. When a 2-point words is used it makes a sentence weaker than when a 3-point is used.<n><n>### Input<n><n>The next instruction will give you a short passage that contains two or three sentences. You will need to correct the sentence(s) that contains an error. The first letter of the correction will be given, but not the correction itself.<n>### Instruments: Correct the error in a sentence.<n><n>### Rationale: The next instruction will give you two sentences. One sentence contains an error. The error will first be given in letters at the beginning of the sentence, for example, "The first sentence contains an error" or, "The second sentence contains an error. In the second sentence, it should be followed by the error as in "The second sentence contains the error" or, "In the second sentence, the error should be

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		James is either a student or a teacher. Therefore, James could keep the  clipboard in a desk, an office supply store, or a place of work, so he could easily find it.<n><n>### Subject area: Writing: Mathematical Expressions Represented Symbolically<n><n>### Sub-Subject area: <n><n>The student creates and solves problems related to writing mathematical expressions representatively, as an extension of the previous Grade 3 topic of reading and interpreting mathematical expressions representatively. In particular, the student:<n><n>1. Writes a value and determines the product of one or two factors of a whole number.<n>__Concepts__<n><n>* Using tables to identify the factors and products of a whole number<n><n>#### Instructions for Students:<n><n>Please find the correct response to all questions.<n><n>### Problem:<n>Select the response column that best identifies each statement.<n><n>### Selection:A.<n><n>### Representative response:A.<n><n>Answer: <n>### B.<n>### Representative Response:B.<n><n>Answer:<n>### C.<n>Representative Response:<n><n>Answer:<n><n>### D.<n><n>### E.<n><n>### F.<n><n>### G.<n><n>### H.<n><n>### I.<n>Representative Responses:<n><n>### Question:<n><n>### Instructions:Find each quotient below.<n><n>### Input 1: <n><n>### Input2: <n><n>## Response: <n><n>Answer:  2<n><n>### Input3:<n><n>### Input4:<n><n>## # of Divisors:<n><n>Answer: 46<n><n>### Input5:<n><n>## #  of Divisors: <n><n>Answer:(-1), 2, 31, and 35<n><n>### Q7A:<n><n>### R1:<n>#### 46<n>Answer: 40<n><n>## Quotient Division<n><n>### Q8A:<n><n>## Division Rules for Divisors:  <n><n>- Divisors are not equal: <n><n>    - When divisors are zero, one, or positive but not equal to 5, then one of them is a quotient and the other is the remainder.

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where can you get in shape and drink at a juice bar? Choices:  A: fridge B: limejuice C: square D: gym E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		A, or D<n><n>### Response Explanation: <n><n>The juice is at a gym, so the answer is A or D.<n><n>This question was written to find if the student knows that there are multiple ways to solve a problem.<n><n>Answer:<n>E

Choices:  A: jungle B: bamboo grove C: australian outback D: china E: child's book<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Reasoning:The koala lives in the areas where you will normally find panda's.<n><n>### InputThe museum made an odd choicetofor the koala display, the stuffed creature in whatarea where you'd usuallyfind a panda. Choices<n>a)jungle<n>b)bamboo grove<n>c)australian outback<n>d)china<n>e)child's book<n><n>The koala lives in places where you would usually find a panda. Since A,B,C and D,E are the only choices that aren't Australia or another panda habitat, then C, Australia, is the only answer.<n><n>### ResponseC<n><n>### Reasons:<n>The koala lives where you normally find pandas. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where would you put silverware once they've dried, but you're not ready to use them. Choices:  A: table B: restaurant C: cupboard D: kitchen E: sink<n><n>### Response:		D : kitchen<n><n>### Justification: B: C: kitchen is the only option that can take both Dry, not ready to use, and Table,<n><n>### Input Two options: B: kitchen, C: table<n><n>### Response Two options: D: cupboard, E: sink<n><n><n>### Input One option: B: restaurant<n><n>### Response One option: A: table<n><n>Difference: B: restaurant cannot take both Dry and Not ready to use, since it is either dry or not ready to use<n><n>### Input and Answer Three options A : cupboard, B : kitchen, C : sink<n><n>### Answer Three options D: table, C: sink<n><n>## Input One, Two and three choices: A:cupboard, B:table D: kitchen C: sink<n><n>Response Two: D:table<n><n>Justification: B, D takes both Dry and Not Ready To Use, therefore, B: kitchen C :sink or D:table has two options to complete given task.<n><n>Answer Two: D:table and sink<n><n>Input 1 two choices: A:table, B:Sink D:Kitchen C:Cupboard<n><n>Response 1 Two Choices: D:cupboard and A:table<n><n>Answer 1 Two Choices<n>B:Sink, C:Kitchen,<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: neatness B: selfishness C: mistakes D: cleanliness E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		A.  Correct.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>If you say the answer is A. But you will get the score to 0.<n><n>Comment: I disagree with your claim that there is no difference between the "rationale" here and "instruction". This instruction asks students to explain why they answered the way they did. The rationale gives hints as to their correct answer without simply telling them that their answer is in fact correct.<n><n>Answer: We don't know what the instructor wants and what your understanding of what they want is.<n><n>"How many cards do they have..." is unclear--is it "in all" as you have answered or "together?" The last sentence could mean "in all", but the reference to "each of them" sounds like "the numbers for each of them" might be necessary or asked for.<n><n>I like that the answer to your question is actually "the number of cards in all"--the "110 + 135 + 46."<n><n>Comment: It is the number of cards in all. It does actually say the total number of cards they all have in all. It's an odd question.<n><n>Comment: But the first sentence just says "How many cards?" so you can't say that the question asks the total unless they say that--and "in all" is also not in the prompt.  You have to figure out what is in fact being asked.<n><n>Comment: "In all?" can indicate the total, but only if the problem asks for a total. If the question asks "How many cards does Janet have?" instead of "How many cards does..." then "in all" wouldn't mean anything as it's not part of the problem.<n><n>Comment: No.  It would mean how many cards do they have "in all" -- if it were a test question--not just some writing exercise--it would be a question that someone might answer wrong and have to be penalized or explained.  I have never seen a question that used "in all" without also adding the number of cards each one has in some way.  This is "how many cards do they have...?" not "How many cards are there in all??"<n><n>Comment: I suppose it depends on context.  I read "in all" to be referring to the three people, not to how many cards they each have.

Choices:  A: sit B: being sociable C: talk D: drinking E: medium<n><n>### Response:		Choice: A, Sit<n>### Demonstartion:<n>This is the correct choice because when having food at a formal event, one is usually required to sit.<n><n>#### Answer: A,Sit<n><n>### Input1:When meeting with people, what are you more likely to do? Choices:A: being sociable B: talking, C: drinking, D: choosing.<n><n>### Response1:Choice: A,being sociable<n><n>### Demostration:<n>This is the response because when meeting people, one is more likely to be sociable.<n>  <n>#### Answer: A,being sociable<n>  <n>### Input2:When meeting someone, you will A: be sociable or B: talk to some people, C: chose a seat, D: talk to the person in your conversation.<n>### Response2:Choice: A, be sociable<n>### Demostartion:<n>You should be more likely to be sociabale, rather than talk to someone, then chose a seat and talk to the person you were talking to before.<n>#### Answer: A.be being sociable<n><n>## 3.2<n>Write two rationales for choices C and D<n><n>Inputs:<n><n>### Instrucion:<n><n>Which of the following statements are true? Choices: A: The moon is smaller than the sun<n>B: the sun is larger than the moon<n>C: the sun is smaller than the moon<n>D: the sun is heavier than the moon<n><n>Response: Choice: A, The moon is smaller than The sun<n><n>Demostartion: The sun is the closest star to Earth, while the sun is the largest and nearest star to Earth.<n>As a result, since the sun is the closest star, it is bigger than the moon.<n>The moon is smaller than the Earth, or bigger than the Earth than the sun, so it is smaller than the sun.<n>#### Answer: The sun is the largest and closest star to earth.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Which of the statements are true?<n>Choices: C: The sun is lighter than the moon<n>D The sun is heavier than The Moon\<n>B: The sun is larger than The moon<n>A: The sun is smaller than The moon<n><n>Response:<n>Choices: A: The sun
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Always wash your hands before eating, you don't want to get germs onto food and inside your what? Choices:  A: water B: doctor C: spread disease D: mouth E: ear<n><n>### Response:		D for mouth.<n><n>### Rationales: Always wash your hands before you eat because bacteria and other germs get on your hands when you use the bathroom or touch something dirty. If you don't wash your hands you will spread those germs on your food and possibly inside of you which will cause you to get really sick.<n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n># **2-3 Foldable**<n><n>Folds :<n>* Page 1 has 2 folds on it<n>    <n>    One:<n>        Horizontal fold on the middle line with a 1.5 inch gap when folded.<n>        The left top corner is 3.5 inches from the line going across the paper, and the right top corner is 1.5 inches from the same line.<n>    <n>    Two:<n>        Vertical fold is 2.5 inches from the column of paper.<n>    <n>On the second page, there are two folds on it.<n>    <n>    One horizontal fold on the middle column with a.5 inch gap when it is folded.<n>    One vertical fold is created 2.5 inches in from the column of paper<n><n><n><n>### 20562532-4.png<n><n><n>![Foldable ](../assets/20562732-1.png)<n><n>![Foldables](../assets/22362712-1.png)*<n><n><n>![Folds](../assets/21662712.png*<n><n><n><n>#### 14<n>Answer: 15<n><n><n>![Foliable](../assets/235627121.png)<n>![Foliable 2](../assets/27662718.png)<n>![Final Foldables](../assets.zip)<n><n>## 3<n>![3 Foldable ](../336271845.png)*<n><n>![Folds ](../32362767.png)*<n><n>### Foldable 1:<n>* Folds:<n>    1: Horizontal folds on left top corner is 7.5 inches.<n>* Page 2:<n>	|  |<n>	
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What kind of radio does someone use to reach base? Choices:  A: vessel B: box C: transistor D: submarine E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### 1/14/2022 3:42:30 PM<n>A.A: vessel : B: box : C: transistor : D: submarine : E: lamp<n>Radio is made to talk to other people over a long distance.<n><n>There is more than one kind of radio. Transistor radio is kind of radio used to talk to other people with submarine radio.<n><n>#### 12/16/2021 4:16:33 AM <n>L: C<n><n>#### 10/5/2021  1:23:37 PM<n>A: vessel<n><n>#### 11/3/2021   8:03:20 AM<n>C  <n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. By definition it is not three-dimensional. Maps are often, but not always, limited to the Earth, as they may be to all space.<n><n>### Second rationale:Already now GPS is common in many vehicles in the world, with new cars usually having GPS built in to them, this is especially common in Europe.<n>This has caused many people to carry smaller un-upate Gps devices.<n><n>### Third rationale:For navigational systems to work, they need the map of the entire region in which the driver or ship is driving.<n><n>Answer:2nd and third choice  (Already now GPS  is common in  many vehicles in  the world ,  with new cars  usually having GPS  built in to them ,  this is especially common in  Europe .<n><n># GPS

Choices:  A: carpet B: refrigerator C: breadbox D: fridge E: coach<n><n>### Response:		<n>Refrigerator, Refrigerator<n><n>### Input<n>The forgotten leftover's had gotten quite old?he found that it was covered in.mold in the back of.his <n>Which what?  A: carpet  B: refrigerat  C: breadbox  D: fridg  E: coach<n><n>Which is? A: carpet  A: Breadbox  B: coach  B: fridge  C: refrigerator<n><n>Answer: C<n><n>### Instructions<n>Choose the correct answer.<n><n>### Input <n>Kelly is 20 feet tall. Kelly is 4 feet taller than her grandfather. What is the height of Kelly's grandfather?<n><n>Choices:  A: 20 feet  B: 21 feet  C: 6 feet  D: 15 feet<n><n>### Answer<n>B<n><n>### Instructons<n>Choose the correct response.<n><n>### What is 5?<n><n>In which direction is the next digit in 0668752940?<n><n>Choices: A: Left  B: Right  C: Neither  D: Both<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instuctons<n>Complete the following table:<n><n>|**X**|**Y**|**Z**|<n>|:----|:----|:-----|<n>|A+B|A+C|X+B+C|<n><n>### Instictions<n>Fill each row in the table in turn.<n><n>### Instrictions<n>Answer to the question:<n>What has 5 000 feathers but can't fly?<n><n>Choices <n>A: Duck<n>B: Cat <n>C: Ostrich<n>D: Chicken<n><n>Answer: D
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		B<n>### Rationale: After getting a divorce what is often the result? Choices: 	 A: unhappiness B: unhappiness C: happiness D: sadness E: anguish<n><n>### Response D<n><n>### Rationale for response: Divorce can be a very painful time.<n><n>### Input 1: In a game of hide-and-seek, 10 children are hiding at 2-minute intervals. What is the least number of children that will be able to find 5 other children without looking in their hiding spots?<n><n>### Input-Output:<n>1: 4<n>2: 14<n>3: 24<n>4: 34<n>5:241<n>Input: 4 + 4 = <<4+4=8>>8<n><n>4 + 14 = <<4+14=18>>18<n><n>4 +18 = 22<n><n>4 + 22 + 4 = 28<n><n>28 ÷ 5 = 5.6<n><n>5.6 + 0.6 = 6.2<n><n>6.2 is the number of years ago the Earth was formed.<n><n>### Problem Solving: Input: Which number is in the middle between 2 and 5.9? A. 5.9 B. 3. C. 2 D. 1<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Rationales: The average number between 2 and 9 is 5 and so the answer A is 5.9.<n><n>### Answer: A<n><n>### Input for Problem Solving: You have 800 cents. The number of red pennies, white pennies, blue pennies and orange pennies in your pocket is how many times as many as the number of red pennys?<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Ratiation: 800 = 800 - 400<n><n>### Rate of 2 of any other color/1 red penny<n><n>2/800 =.025<n><n>800 - 25 = 775<n><n>###  Input for Problem Solving : How many more pennies do you need to have

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: neighborhood B: subdivision C: city D: suburbs E: street<n><n>### Response:		Neighborhood<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Considering a house to be in a neighborhood if it is surrounded by other houses without any physical obstruction. Other places like cities, suburbs, and subways have their own streets.<n><n>There are no gated places in these areas.<n><n>Considering streets as a place to stay would mean getting the most public properties if you go looking on the streets.<n>Even if you have a gated home and there are other gated units, you will still have to walk to the streets. This happens in the most gated areas if you consider the subways and cities. The streets are the common places where people go to or through so having a gate around your streets is not really the same as having a house in a neighborhood. The suburbs are like streets when they need to be because they also have high traffic.<n><n>#### Answer:B<n><n>Input:What is the sum of 2/5 of the sum of 2x/5 of the sum 3x?<n><n>### Rationales:Since the input is a question, it is not possible to answer it. Rather, it should be turned into a proper input so that the task can be assigned a definite correct answer.<n><n>#### Answer to input:<n><n>Input: 2/5 + 2(x)/5 + 3(x)<n><n>### Rationale:Considering the input to be an equation instead of a question.<n><n>Input: The solution to the equation is either 6/7.<n><n>### Ratiate:From the choices given, it seems that there's no other rational that satisfies the rules of an equation.<n><n>#### Answering<n><n>Answer: 6/7<n><n>### Instructions: What is the value of x? Choices: A: x= -499 B: x=0 C: x is undefined D: x=1000<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: x= -489<n><n>### Rationate:<n>-489 - x = -499<n><n>If x can be found, -489 - x will be equal to -499. This statement is a statement of equality, which will produce true or false.<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>A: x = -489<n>#### Answer<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Mark's semen was very thick, but after his vasectomy it was also what? Choices:  A: blank B: sparse C: thin D: clear E: free flowing<n><n>### Response:		A or B or D may be correct but E is incorrect.<n><n>### Input:"My doctor's assistant's brother's wife's cousin's brother told me to get to know my doctor's assistant better, so I don't feel so awkward when I see him." What is the doctor's assistant' name if the person knows only the above data?<n><n>### Response:"My doctor's Assistant's brother's Wife's cousin is" or "My doctor's assistant is "<n>### Above is NOT an instruction or task. It is an example of a response.<n>

Choices:  A: demonstration B: garage C: building D: barn E: synagogue<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the person in the question is talking about a garage, you would know that 5/2 is 1 = a.<n><n>If the person is talking about a building, you would know that the word building contains the word _ing_ which means "To do". So "how to do the work" means to build. Therefore, B must be the correct answer, as the work is being built.<n><n>If the question is about a synagogue, the word temple is usually used. Since the word temple is used, it is safe to answer A as it is a synagogue.<n><n>If the answer is a house of worship, then the question should be "Where does the person live". That would mean the person lived in a building, not a garage, so it should definitely NOT be building. B would be the correct answer, because the work is being built inside of a building.<n><n>Lastly, the words in the choices all have different meanings, such as garage having to do with vehicles or a container. 5/2, in a mathematical sense, being used in relation to a barn or barn yard. Therefore, you should not choose A.<n><n>You should look at the wording of the question (in this case house of worship - temple - bend), instead of the meaning, and then choose the right answer.<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input :The word has 3 syllables. Can you count what the person is saying? Choices: 1. yes 2. no 3. 3 syllables<n><n>### Response :No.<n><n>If something has three syllables, then it would contain three of a particular sound in a word. If we look at our example "God - dog - bad" we can see that _-dog-_ is the third syllable, because it uses the same letter twice.<n><n>God: 1 syllable<n><n>dog: 2 syllables<n><n>bad: 3 syllables (the final consonant sound is dropped which would reduce it to 2, even though the rest in the same sound)<n><n>If the person says they have three syllables, they mean that the word has three sounds instead of three syllables, which is 1 + 2 + 1 = 4, not three.<n><n>#### 2

Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		<n>If a person has a headache they won’t be happy. The compliment is the one way to make someone happy. The same goes for the happiness. But, if the person is very grumpy then its likely that he or she won’t get any compliments.<n><n>### Input 2:Which of the following is not the reason that people don’t like to read more? Choices:  a: they think it’s difficult b: they have other things to do c: they don’t like to waste time d: they don’t know what it’s all about<n><n>### Response 2:<n>The book does not explain them well as to why people don’t like t read.<n><n>### Question: What is the best answer to the question “What do you like to do on your days off?”? I prefer to be on the go as much as I can during my spare time<n><n>### Response<n>I love to relax with some friend and watch TV.<n>### D<n>### C<n>### C<n><n>### Input Choices:  1. What can you find in your mailbox if someone is looking for you? Choices: a: an ad b: a bill c: a notice d: an order<n><n>### Response Choices: You can only find a notice in your mailbox if you are looking for it<n><n>### Input What does the word "cash" refer to? Choices: A: money in a bank account B: money on a credit card C: the bank in the bank D: dollars E: money in the cash register<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Example:<n>The definition for cash is money that you have in your pocket or a check written by you for money.<n>So, the definition for bank is a building in which money is collected (for safekeeping and for other people to use).<n><n>### Input How can you find out the person’s feelings about a story that he or she’s reading if he/she is reading it for the first time? Choices: A. Ask him/her B. Ask a friend who read it before C. Ask other people in
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where could a fungus grow and not be disturbed by sunlight? Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales: A fungus grows best under rocks.<n><n>#### <n>Answer: A<n>

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Rashida waters it on the days between Jimmy's waterings. How many days have they watered a plant in 8 days?<n><n>### Demostration:1st day->Jimmy->5 days later->Rashida->5 days later->Jimmy->2 weeks 1 day<n><n>Rationales:1st day=>5 days later=>1st day<n>2 weeks 1 day is the 5th day with Jimmy and the 5th day to Rashida.<n><n>Therefore the plant is watered in 8 days.<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input : Mary had $10 and gave 5 dollars to the church. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The fat man refused to accept what was possible, he complained that he what the simplest activities? Choices:  A: no go B: unlikely C: unable D: cant do E: impossibility<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input :<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response :<n>C,<n>### Input<n>The man was not able to do the simplest thing.<n>### Input<n>Answer : D,<n><n>### Input <n><n>### Response <n><n>### Input A:<n><n>### Response A:<n><n>## Input<n><n>### Input B:<n><n>###Response B:<n><n>## Input C:<n><n>### Reponse C:<n><n>## #Input<n><n>### Response # input<n><n>### Response input<n><n>###Input D<n><n>### Response D<n><n>###Input E<n><n>### Response E<n><n>### Input Question :<n>There are many questions in these quiz.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Choices:  A: violence B: falling down C: vomiting D: vomiting E: lower standards<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Rationale:<n>#### D:<n>No, because they get violent. Therefore it will lead them to become a criminal.<n><n>#### B:<n>No, because it leads them to becoming disrespectful.<n><n>#### E:<n>No, because then it might lead them to get angry easily.<n><n>#### C:<n>No, because that is not how they should be.<n><n>#### A:<n>No, because anger and alcohol are not a good mix that could lead them to violence.<n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents.
