How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:They were getting together for the big game, he wasn't hosting but made sure to bring pretty of food with him over to where? Choices:  A: picnic B: friend's house C: table D: space shuttle E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Choice:<n><n>A →  picnic<n><n>B →  friend's house<n><n>C →  table<n><n>D →  space shuttle<n><n>E →  fairgrounds<n><n>I'm going to ask you two words that relate in some way.<n><n>### Input<n>The first word is: <n><n><n>### Response<n><n>Answer:<n><n><n>### Check Your Answers<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the sentence by choosing the best answer.<n><n>### <n><n>### 1.The word pencil is a rhyme because ___.<n><n><table><n>  <thead><n>    <tr><n>      <th rowspan='3'>Answer</th><n>      <th scope='col'>Correct Answer</th><n>      <!-- <th rowspan='4'>Description</th> --><n>    </tr><n>    <tr><th>C</th><td>It is related to the other word in sound</td></tr><n>    <td>Correct</td></tr>    <tr><th rowspan='4' colspan='2'>Correct<br/><n>  Correct</th></tr></thead><n>  <tbody><n>    <tr class='odd'><td>N</td><td>No</td></tr> <n>   <tr class='odd'>  <td>S</td><td>Yes</td></tr>   <tr class='even'>  <td>A</td><td>A</td></tr>            <tr class='odd">  <td>U</td><td>V</td></tr>       <n>  </tbody><n></table><n><n>### Instructon:Complete the following equation using the variables below(2+5)=<<2+5=7>><n>4.5+3=5<n><n>### Instucton:<n><n>### Write the remainder after division.<n>65%7=<<65%7=1>>1<n>x4/6=<<x4/6=2/3>>2/3<n><n>### Instrutio:<n><n>### Read the prompt to learn how many chairs have been stolen.<n><n>### Read:<n><n>### 2 red chairs, which equal the number of people that will use

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Choices:  A: shame B: arrest C: embarrassment D: go to jail E: tension<n><n>### Response:		Answer choice A<n><n>### Reason: The action of perjury is committed by telling lies under an oath; in this case to the government and to the law, so that would lead to shame (answer choice A), it would cause you to look foolish, and the law usually makes an example out of you by sentencing you to jail.<n><n>### Input 1. :You may never have to take a sworn statement; a sworn statement is likely to lead to  A: shame B. arrest C. embarrassment D. tension E. go to jail.<n> <n>### Response 1. : Answer choice A<n> <n>### Reason 1. :You typically will only have to take a "sworn statement" if you are a law enforcement officer, and it is likely that you will be embarrassed about lying, or possibly scared of committing perjury.<n><n>### Question 2:<n><n>### Input : In 30 trials, the number of heads was four  more than the number of tails. If the sample was large enough, can the probability that the difference in the number of tails and head is 6 be considered significant?<n><n>### Reponse 2:  <n><n>### Reasons 2:<n><n>If there is a 30 trial group, that means there were 30 trials where you flipped a coin and recorded the results, and 30 trials flipped a coin for a total of 60 coin flips.<n>In this 30 trial you flipped a 1/2 coin 60 times you would have half expected the number of heads and tails to be the same; however, you flipped 4 more heads than tails, so 4 more out of 60 times a coin came up heads or 6%. So the coin is definitely not perfectly even and the coin can be said to have a bias.<n>So to answer the question, if there is a 3 out of 6 % chance of the bias being the result of chance, then it is not significant, answer choice B<n><n>

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:A soccer field that is not contained in a building would be where? Choices:  A: playground B: mexico C: town D: outside E: world cup<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: A soccer field that is outside a building would have a surface of 2,200 square meters if it is a rectangular field.<n>If you add together the areas of a rectangular field's perimeter that touches the building and the area of the inner field, you may get the area 2,203.74 square meters.<n>If it is an oval that slopes down to the building on one side, the area is 1,179.79 square meters.<n>A soccer field that encloses a building would be outside.<n><n>Rationales: When we add the area of the outer fields and the part that touches the building, the result is 1313 + 793.74 = <<1313+793.75=2106>>2106, which is close to 2,204 square meters. A soccer field must be outside the building.<n>A field that has an oval shape and drops to the building on one end has 222222 square meters.<n>#### 2,1<n>Answer:<n>### Instruction<n>Input: In Houston, the maximum number of players on a basketball court is 12, with 6 or fewer on each team. In Philadelphia, the maximum number of referees on a pick-up basketball court is 6. If there are 5 referees from Houston and 6 players from Philadelphia in a pick-up basketball game, how many games can the referees run in total?<n>Rationales:- The only game that can be performed in Houston, and six games can be completed by players from Philadelphia.<n>The sum of the players and the referees is 11 (the players) plus six (the referees) equal 17. In total, eight games can be completed in Houston and Philadelphia.<n>#### 7<n>Answer:<n>##<n>### Instruction-<n>Input:- In a school football league, there are 3 divisions: Division A, Division B, Division C. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Sky diving scared him, once they jumped out of the plane he began losing consciousness while what? Choices:  A: garage B: hospital C: boat D: house E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is B/E/D since B/E is the doll house and D is a house and E is the dollhouse, so all of these are houses.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In this question they said that they were looking for a house therefore we can assume that they are doing an emergency, like a hospital, which would have fire extinguish in it. Or the garage, which is a part of the house, or the garage the cars are being parked in which has a fire extinguisher. Or the boat, in a boat we often have a fire extinguish to avoid fires in the boat. We can ignore A because it is a garage and it is a part of a house. And we can ignore C because it is the doll house and it is in a house and it is a doll house. So the answer is B, E, or D.<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>D = B<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Demand: Answer the following question.<n><n>```Example<n>A number is subtracted from 13, the larger number is less than the smaller number. If 3 more is added to the smaller number and the product is subtracted from 9, the result is 11. Find the number and the number that is the smaller number.<n>Rationales:<n>3 more to the smaller number = <<3+>>6+<<7=7>>5 + 5 = 6 + 5 = 11, product 11 - 11(smaller number that is less than 13 subtraction the larger number) --> 11 - 9 = <<3+>>9 - 2 = 16 + 2 = 14<n><n>(Smaller number is 7)<n>```<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following question<n><n>### Input<n>How do you solve two variable problems? How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Bob's feet hurt from running barefoot on the hot pavement.  I lost his shoes, didn't know where they landed, and had to run from the corner store to his home.  About where did he run? Choices:  A: a bed of nails B: town C: attractive consistent look D: city block E: ground<n><n>### Response:		Answer A.<n><n>#### 26<n><n>Input: Bob's feet hurt from....<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What could a massive building be if it is not constructed well? Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n><n>### Response:		A<n>Input: When people discover something new while Chatting with friends, Why are they likely to continue to chat?<n>Option: (D) If someone is talking about an idea, then other people can easily agree or disagree with them.<n>Option: (B) After they spend some time chatting to their friends online, they will quickly talk to their friends offline to chat.<n>Option: (C) People feel discomfort when they cannot solve an idea or concept with your friends.<n>Option: (A) A: agreement If someone is talking about their ideas, then other people can agree or disagree with this.<n>Option (E): People learn new things when they chat with their friends.<n>#### (C)<n>Answer: C: discomfort<n>

She can choose any 4 positive numbers from her set and get a 0. She might choose a set and get a 1 or a 0. Write a statement that completes the table. Choices: A: The student can choose any set of positive numbers and get a 1. B: The student can get a 1 or zero for each possible set. C: The student must choose all positive integers to avoid a 0 outcome. She might choose a 0 or 1 for any set.<n><n>### Response :<n>Response : C<n>The student must choose all positive numbers to avoid a 0 output.<n><n>### You should write responses in complete sentences.<n><n>### When necessary, provide explanations to support your statements. Explanations are generally 1 or more sentences.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>For questions 1 through 4, select a box from the left to indicate the answer that corresponds best to the question.<n>### Question 1:<n>1. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What would happen to a person if his or her money is stolen? Choices:  A: complete sentence B: feel angry C: drink tea D: cross street E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### If money is stolen by someone, the victim probably feel angry.<n><n>### We can't cross street in order to park on sidewalk.<n><n>### When our money is stolen, we feel angry because we feel that the thief is cheating us by taking our money.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Glass that hasn't been treated to be extra strong is what? Choices:  A: weak B: fragile C: forceless D: regular E: flimsy<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is:<n>D = forceless<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The word forceless is defined as: not having or requiring much force.<n>So, the answer is D = forceless<n>### Instruction :<n>A tutor told a pupil that the word forceless in part of the instructions is the noun type.<n>### Input:<n>The word that is the type of the verb _________ is defined as any quality of _________ which will not resist pressure.<n><n>### Response(n or v):<n>The word that is defined as a the verb type is noun.<n>The verb type of "pressu" is noun while the definition of the verb pressu is to make someone or something apply pressure onto someone or something.<n><n>### Input :<n>A bird can eat 7 berries in just one day. How many berries can a bird eat in 9 days?<n><n>### RESPOND :<n>The answer is: 63<n><n>### Inputs:<n>A class has 42 pencils, 29 erasers, and 14 rulers. How many pencils are there that are exactly half as many erasers as there are rulers?<n><n>### Input Respond (e or n):<n>The response is: 17<n><n>### Rationales:<n>a)The ratio of pencil to ruler is e/n = <<e/n=29/42>>3/4<n>b)The ratio of ruler to eraser is n/e = <<n/e=42/29>>15/9<n>3/4/15/9 = <<3/4/14/9=9/16>>5/8<n>c)5/8 is half of whole<n>d)15% of 42 = 6<n>15% of 14 = 2<n>e)In 9 days, 6 + 2 = <<6+2=8>>8 eraser will be eated. and 42/8 = <<42/8=5>>5 ruler will be eated.<n>f)the last 8 eraser and the last 5 ruler are one of the ruler of 50% as many eraser as there are r
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is an area with no grass where I can get things to sell at a roadside stand? Name this item? Choices:  A: electric locomotive B: electric typewriter C: multi-coloured walrus D: electric refrigerator E: electric drill<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input : The United States, Russia, and China each possess nuclear weapons. Which country has the fewest nuclear warheads in the world? Choices:  - China.  -  Russia.  -  United States.  -  None of the other choices<n><n>### Response :  None of the other Choices<n><n>### Inputs: 1. There were 575 people attending a party on February 14th. 2. There were 556 people attending a party March 31st. 3. What is the difference? What is missing?<n><n>### Answer: -19<n><n>### Input1: If a person has 2.02 kg and 1.4 metres, what is the person's (average) mass? Choices:  <a href="http://mymath.ca/3f/s/1936095/">A</a>  <a href="https://mymath.ca/3f1"><img height="100" width="100" src="$1"></img></a>  <a><img height="10" width="15" src="$1"></i></a>  <span></a> <n><n>### Response1: <a href="http:"><img height="3" src="$1"></a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<n><n>### Input2: <n><n>### Input3: <a href="https:"><img height="150" width="160" src="$1"><img height="350" width="350" src="$11"></a>&nbsp;<n><n>## 📖 Readings<n><n>- [Introduction](./README.md)<n>- [Chapter 2: Mathematical Problem Solving](./Chapter 2/README.md)  <n>- [Chapter](README.md) <a href="#" target="_blank">3</a>  <n>- [Chapetr](3/README.md#) <n>- [Chapter3](3/README/Chapter 3.md) <n>- [Section](3/README) <n>- [Preface](README/README) 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:If I am a person, I have a unique ability to do what? Choices:  A: cross street B: stand upright C: speak spanish D: speak chinese E: further education<n><n>### Response:		I am a person.<n>### Reason:I can cross street.

Which one?<n>\### Response:<n>lemur is more common<n><n><n>### Response <n><n>This lemur:<n><br>![screenshot_20211025-092137_10_by_b62ecd9cbca79012aac8701a946799b2.jpg](/uploads/03f54346d5292f4d8e8e0d61650402c0.jpg)<n><n><n><n>### A lemur can be found in the picture below. Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The answer is C.<n><n><n>### Rationale:In addition, you should provide a Rationale for choosing your chosen answer. If no rationale is provided, you may fail.<n><n><n>## Input:He waited for her at the squash court. But he was worried she might think he meant the other end of the **what** public building?<n><n>### Demand:<n>Input: He waited for her at the **what** public meeting place.<n>Rationales: He is looking for a squash court.<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Demaration:<n>Response: A<n><n>### Exercise:<n>It might be better to use other than this response.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The squash court is an **A** word. The question is asked for the public building and you answered with a sports building.<n><n>### Exculpation:<n>It may not be used instead of.<n><n><n>## Demand:<n>Input:- He waited for her at a squash court. But I was worried if she might think I was referring to the other end of the.<n><n>### Answer:B<n><n>### Demarcation:<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Explantion:<n>The answer to the question is a place to do. You cannot refer to the city.<n><n>### Reason:<n>In the second part of the answer he is asking where? The answer is the squash court not the other place.<n><n>### Inclusive:<n>It includes: fitness center, public meeting places, country club, pool, park.<n><n>### Out:<n>Excluded<n><n>### Exclamation Marks:<n>-A<n>-Squash court<n>-Sports and public areas<n><n>### Exclusive:<n>-He is afraid his friend may think he is referring to other public facilities.<n>### Inclusivity:<n>-He referred to the public playgrounds to a public health and fitness center.<n><n>### Solution:<n>-There is no solution. There are all possible answers.<n><n>### He waited for her at her squash court. But her friend was worried if she thought he might mean the other end of the squash court in the city.<n><n>-It may not be better to have
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What type of home is most likely to have an attic filled with historical items? Choices:  A: top of home B: older houses C: victorian house D: own home E: material<n><n>### Response:		<n>B is correct. Answer: B<n><n>### Input Choices:<n>B is correct for the following reasons:<n><n>#### A:<n>Attic is the top of a home. Top of home is not an attic.<n><n>#### B:<n>Older home can be an attic. Older house is not an attic since you can put the word home before it.<n><n>#### C:<n>Victorian home can have attics. Victorian house is not an attica.<n><n>#### D:<n>Material home cannot have attics. Material is not an attic-like item. <n><n>#### E:<n>Material cannot have attic. Material is not an item that resembles an attic.<n>

Choices:  A: unimportant B: insignificant C: stellar D: somewhat E: helpless<n><n>### Response:		<n>The camper was helpless because the night sky left him feeling unimportant.<n><n>### Input;Sam spent a week in the backcountry camping. Each day, she had to collect 10 pounds of wood to keep her campfire going. How many pounds of wood did she have to collect all together? Choices: <n><n>### A:  150 pounds  <n><n>### B:  140 pounds  <n> <n>### C:  <98>  <n>  <n>### D:   132 pounds  <n>  <n>## :  <A> <n><n>## :  <B> <n><n>##  <C>  <n><n>##  <D> <n><n>## <E><n><n>## : <F><n><n>##  <G><n><n>## <H><n><n>## <K><n><n>## :<L><n><n>##  :<M><n><n>##     <I><n><n>## <J><n><n>## <N> <n><n>##   <O><n><n>## <P> <n><n>##      <Q> <n><n>##     <R> <n><n>##    <S> <n><n>##<T><n><n>##     :<U><n><n>## :  :<V><n><n>##     :(<W><n><n>## <Y><n><n>## [ <Z> <n><n>##               <x><n><n>##     [ <y><n><n>##           [ <z><n><n>##     ] <t> <n><n>##         ] < u> <n><n>##            ] <v><n><n>##             ] <x><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? Choices:  A: boredom B: patience C: time D: teachers E: inspiration<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. Boredom<n><n>#### <n>Answer: B<n><n><n>### Input;Choices:<n>A: If a student has a phone, a headphone cord, a laptop, and a computer. Which of the following best describes them? A: rich B: poor C: in a middle class? D: none of the above E: a millionaire<n><n>### Response;Answers:<n>C D<n><n><n>### Instructions<n>Choose one of the following questions. Submit a 2-inch response that includes your name, your math teacher's name, and your answer and  explanation for the choice you made.<n><n>### Question: What is the perimeter of the octagon in your classroom? For help with Perimeter, see  https://www.dailymathpractice.com/25-1-perimeter-examples-worksheets-problem-solution/<n>### Answer: Perimeter = 2(side1+side2+side3+side4+...+side8)<n><n>### 25<n>#### 25<n>Answer: Perimeter (side1+side2) + (side1+side3) + (side1 + side4)<n>I choose this equation because if the answer is 44 it is in the right answer box. This answer is easy to understand.<n><n>### 16<n>#### 16<n>Answer: Perimeter + (side1+ side2) + (side3+side4)<n>I choose that one because there are only 8 sides so this shows that if the answer is 70 it is in the right answers box.<n><n>###  8<n>####  8<n>Answer: Total points + perimeter +  side1 + side2<n>the only difference is side1+side2.<n><n>### None of those answers.<n>#### None of those answers.

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Choices:  A: cabinet B: pantry C: kitchen D: cupboard E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		<n>### The correct answer is cupboard.<n><n>### Rationale (optional):<n><n><n>### Input.<n><n>### Response.<n><n>### The correct response is choice B. The question asks about a type of box. Boxes hold books, but they do not hold canned food, so excluding choice B is appropriate. Choice D is not the type of box that is typically found where canned food is stored, so it is inappropriate. Choice A specifies the type of room, which is not relevant to the question. Choice C is the correct spelling of a type of large box, not the type of box used to store food (so excluding choices C is appropriate). Choice E is a type of wall-mounted box, but not the type of box typically used to store canned food, which is the kind of box that would be found behind a cupboard (so excluding choice E is appropriate).<n><n>Input: The students were given different tasks to do. Some of the students played, some cleaned, and others cooked. How many students did the three tasks in all?<n>Rationale: The two statements are false. In addition, any true statement alone is insufficient to get the correct answer. To answer the question, at least two statements are needed and they must be relevant in some way<n><n>Answer: 15<n><n>input:Aaron bought 3 t-shirts for $35 and 1 pair of pants for $33. He spent a total of $32 on his items. How much did his pants cost?<n>rationales: Aaron bought 3 t shirts for $3 x 3 = <<3*3=9>>9 <n>and 1pair of pants for $12*1=<<12*1=12>>12.<n>A total of $35 + $9 + $12 = 56.<n>Aaron spent $56 + $3 = $59 <n>Thus Aaron's pants cost $13.<n>####13<n>Answer: 13<n><n>input:Jessica and Dani met each other for the first time today. Choose all that apply. Choices: A: wood B: plants C: paper D: chemicals <n><n>### Response The chemical reaction B burn can burn wooden furniture, firewood, paper, or combustible materials.<n><n>### Explaination: It burns the wood, paper, or chemicals<n><n>### Explain in a sentence or less<n>It burns wood, paper, or combusted materials <n><n>### Expand on the above.<n>It burns combusted materials, which can mean anything burnt such wood, paper, or even chemicals like in a chemistry lab.<n><n>### Write a response that appropriatly completes the request. Provide your explanations throughout this response.<n>#### <n>A: Chemical C: Plants<n><n>### Input How do volcanoes erupt? Choices: 1 : Volcanic eruptions are caused when magma, or molten rock, wells up into a volcano and breaks through the Earth's crust. 2 : Some volcanos emit gases rather than smoke. 3 : Some eruptions occur without smoke or lava.  Choose the best answer for each.<n><n>### Response Choice One<n><n>### Expansion/Rationale:  Volcanic eruption is caused when magma, molten rock, well.<n><n>### Answer:1<n><n>### Input Which of these statements about volcanoes is correct? Choices:  Volcanoes erupt when there is an increase in pressure beneath the Earth's crushing surface. Volcanic eructions occur without an increase in pressure. Volcanoes erupt in places where two plates meet or separate. Volcanoes are most frequently found where two volcanoes erupt.  Choose the statement that is NOT correct. Choose one.<n><n>### Rationale:  When pressure comes to a volcano it explodes, so when there is no increase of pressure the volcano will not explode.<n><n>### Choice Not correct<n><n>### Expansoin/Rationale:  When there is no increase of earths pressure, the volcano will not erupt<n><n>### Answer Choice Two

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:John joined the army because he wanted to see the world.  When the fighting started, he only saw what sort of things? Choices:  A: fort B: orphans C: battlefield D: other countries E: war<n><n>### Response:		A<n>#### Answer:A<n><n>### Input:(1x25 = 25) + (2x100 = 200)+ (2x30 = 60) = _____<n><n>### Response:(1x25 + 2x100 + 2x30 = _____)<n><n>#### Answer:850<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:what happens to a company when it is bankrupt? Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. Choices:  A. a secluded place B. a beach C. a mountain D. home<n><n><n>### Response2:<n><n>To find tranquility one should seek a secluded place, but not necessarily a beach. One is likely to be more comfortable and rested if they choose a mountain to climb. While a nice beach vacation is relaxing on a good day, it tends to feel crowded a lot of the time.<n><n>### Conclusion: <n><n>I have been told since Kindergarten to think before I answer. I need to rethink my thinking process. If I don't then what's the point?<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What would a document be if it is not obtuse? Choices:  A: pointed B: bright C: easy D: clear E: acute angled<n><n>### Response:		Answer with one or more complete sentences. Input<n><n>### Comment:<n><n>#### 145<n><n>Input: Seth is a farmer. He feeds 6 chickens, 3 rabbits, 4 cows, and 2 sheep. How many animals does Seth feed?<n>Rationales<n><n>Seth feeds 2 sheep + 3 rabbits + 4 cows + 6 chickens = <<2+3+4+6=17>>17 animals together.<n>#### 17<n>Answer: 17<n><n>### Input<n><n>#### #1329 : I just don't get it<n>#### #330 : Help Please<n>#### #8112 : How to do an algebraic equation<n>#### #8107 : Need help<n>https://education.azpbs.org/videoplayer/video/9968/39032<n>https://educator.azpbs.net/sites/learner/files/A_Zebras_Have_Stripes.pdf<n><n>#### #8829 : Turtles on a fence post<n>https://educateheronpress.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Zebras-and-Fences.pdf<n>https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/already+a<n>https://www.tutor.com/lesson/word-problems--making-advanced-algebraic-equations_mathematics-24524741?tapp=5sZkWf2Fc7<n>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wQ2Jk055QcY<n>https://www.education.az.gov/standards/mathematics-standards/<n>https://www.azed.gov/standards-practices/mathematics/<n><n>https://www.cctm.edu/already-a-b-teacher-re-entry-a-math/<n><n>#### #9347 : turtles<n>https://math.hws.edu/mrwood/courses/101/math/turtles.pdf<n>https://math.

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? Choices:  A: copy B: intelligent C: improved performance D: empowering E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Answer:B<n>```<n>#### Answer 0<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>#### Answer 1<n>There are 44 cards in the set.<n><n>### Solution:<n>1. How many more cards does Janet have than Brenda?<n><n>     |      |      |      |<n>     |   Janet   |   Brenda  |<n>     \|/      |      /\|<n><n>```<n>The cards have 52. Janet has 13 cards, Brenda has 3, so Janet has 16.<n><n>```<n>The number 16 - 10 = <<16-10=6>>6 is more than the number 3.<n><n>```<n>Since the number 3 is less than the number 5 (16-3 = <<16-3=13>>13), Janet has 10 more cards than Brenda. So Janet has 6 + 10 = <<6+10=16>>16 cards and Brenda has 3 + 10 = 13 + 10 > 23 cards.<n><n>```<n> 13 + 3<n><n>2. How many cards did Mara start with?<n><n>     |    |    |    |<n>     |   Brenda  Janet   |<n>     |/\|  |    |/\|<n>     |      |  |      |<n><n>```<n>Janet has 52 - 52/3 = <<52-52/3=17>>17 cards more than Brenda and 52 - < 13 + 9 > = <<52-12=37>>37 cards less than Brenda.<n><n>```<n>Janets card set is: {52-< 13 + 5 > = 37} and < 13 +8/3 = 11 > cards.<n><n>``` Mara starts with 52 - 9 + 3 + 5 = <<52-9+3+5>>40 /3 = <<52/3-9>=14>>14 cards<n><n>3. How many fewer cards does Mara have than 150 after she buys 30 cards?<n><n>     |     |

Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What might a person receive from their boss if they do a poor job? Choices:  A: misfortune B: fearful C: criticism D: make mistakes E: promotion appraisal<n><n>### Response:		B or E<n>Answer: E or B<n><n>#### 33<n>Answer: 53<n><n>### Instructions:This file requires a.pdf reader:<n>### Input:Journey and Treasu made cookies. Journey baked and Treasu shaped and decorated the cookies. Journey, Treasu, and their grandma, Mizu, ate all the cookies. There were ten cookies. Mizu said, "One cookie is always enough when one is with friends." Did Mizu enjoy all ten of the cookies?<n>Rationales<n>The number of cookies all three people ate is 1  + 1  + 3 = <<1+1+3=5>>5 cookies.<n>Since it is 5 cookies, 1  + 5 = <<1+5=6>>6, so, at least 1 person must have had 6 cookies.<n>#### 64<n>Answer: Mizu<n><n>### Instructons:Please provide a response to a request:<n><n>### Request:Please determine the sum of 1, 6, and 5, without adding or subtracting the digits.<n><n>### Rationale:16 + 5 =<<16+5=21>>21<n><n>### Answer:42<n><n>### Instectations:Please provide a response in the following formats to the requests in the instruction.<n>1) What is the sum of 1/4, 0w1, and 7/58?<n><n>### Request and Rationale #1:<n><n>### Answer #1<n>20578<n><n>2) 5 is as a percentage of the sum (5/163)*100<n><n>### Request<n>Please calculate the area of a rectangle with a width of 15 centimeters and a height of 2 centimeters. Round the final, final answer to two decimal places. Type your answer as an integer.<n><n>### Request #2:<n>Annie walked 2.5 miles per hour.<n>In how many hours did she walk 20 miles? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Bob and Boris were standing in a queue at the grocery store.  They were standing in place.  The line was fast, but the children in front of them were loud.   They were what? Choices:  A: frustration B: being annoyed C: delays D: irritation E: out of order<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E: out of order <n><n>### Rationale:<n>A line is fast when it is not going back and forth<n><n>The line was fast but annoyed since they were fast but children where loud.<n>Since they were loud, the line is out of order.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Input: How many gallons of milk is equivalent to 3/4 of a gallon of milk?<n>Rationales 3/4 of 1 gallon = <<3/4*1=7/4>>3/4 gallon<n>1 gallon = <<1*7/4=1~7/4>~1-6/4>1-3/2>1~1/2>1.5~1.5-3/2>2/2>2.5 gallons of milk<n>3/4 gallon = <<3*2/2>~~9/16>>9/16 gallons of milk<n><n>#### 9/16<n>Answer: 9/16 gallon<n><n>### Input : The numbers 2/10, 4/5, and 6/7 are prime numbers. Which ones are composite numbers? <n><n>### Demosntration<n>1/5<n>25/10<n>6/5<n>36/35<n><n>### Rationa:<n>2/10,4/5,6/7 are not composite numbers since all of its number is even and end with zero<n>So 2/10=20/10!=composite <n><n>4/5=8/5=8/25=2/12 not composite<n><n>6/7=8/7=16/49 not composite<n><n>#### 20,8,16<n>Answer: not composite<n><n>### Input  : How much can we sell a dozen bags of kernels in 3 days?<n><n>### Rations:<n>If 12x3=36 kernels<n>and 24x3=72 kernels<n>and so on<n>and 12-12-12=0<n>so total = 72+????<n>(36+???)<n><n>#### 72+35<n>Answer: 107<n><n>### Input<n><n>

Choices: A) 10 B) 18 C) 100 D) 6 B) 18<n><n>### Response 2:An adequate response includes: The correct answer is 18.<n><n>### Rationale: Since there are 6 games in each team, the total number of games would be 6 x 6 = <<6*6=36>>30. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The cow would come outside even after the storm had passed, it wouldn't leave the what? Choices:  A: meat grinder B: stable C: red barn D: gate E: green field<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>> Choices: A: meat grinder<n><n>### Demostration:<n>When it started to snow, it wouldn't just stop, not even after it had finished snowing. The cow didn't just leave the barn once the snow had stopped and it was safe to go outside. After the snowfall, it would go outside without fear of the snow even if it was very cold outside because the farm was equipped with a barn warmer.<n>#### Choice: Meat grinder<n><n>#### 246203<n>Answer: Meat Grinder<n><n>#### B, C, D, E<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the description by writing a complete sentence for each question.<n><n>## 1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:He had a hard time finding the room on his schedule, it was on the second floor and he got lost in the very large what? Choices:  A: school B: office building C: house D: hotel E: centre<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- [A]<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day.
