Choices:  A: shirt pocket B: calligrapher's hand C: inkwell D: desk drawer E: blotter<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- If the right choice does not give sufficient data for completing the request, select the only choice that meets all information needs.<n><n>- If the left choice does not give sufficient information, select the only choice for which information is sufficient.<n><n>### Answer:<n>Option: C<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>- If C. gives you sufficient information, select it.<n><n>If you find "blotter", you would be able to see the rest of the phrase, "blotter paper".<n>Blots used to take moisture from the paper.<n><n>### 1:<n><n>### Answer 1:<n><n>- Option A did not give sufficient information for completing the request.<n><n>- Option C gave you sufficient information.<n><n>### Reasons for Selection:<n><n>- Selecting blotter to absorb ink would be unnecessary because shirt pocket, calligrapher' hand, inkwell, and desk drawer does not explain anything.<n><n>- Since it is a math problem, blotter paper paper could be a way to absorb the ink.<n><n>- Selecting the only choice for which enough information would be available would be useful for completing the request to understand how ink on a fountain pen gets absorbed.<n><n>### B:<n><n>### Reaction B:<n><n>- In the above, Option B had inadequate information for completion.<n><n>- C would be the only option for information.<n><n>## 2:<n><n>### 2:<n><n>- You get extra credit if you solve the problem.<n><n>- If no solution was given, select the only option for the correct formula.<n><n>- If there was no option at all, select the correct equation.<n><n>### Solution 2:<n><n>When you multiply a + b + c + d, you get 11 + 22 + 33 + 44. (1 + 2 + 3 + 4 = 11.) Since 11 + 11 = 22, we can say that adding the digits in the numerator gives 2.<n><n>So, (2)(11 + 1 + 10 + 10) = 20.<n><n>Then, we multiply the 20 on both sides to get an answer.<n><n>

How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What does playing soccer for a long time lead to? Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. Choices:  A: gathering of information B: communication C: feel relaxed D: kill boredom E: social bonding<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: A<n><n>### Demetras Answer:<n>Input: A person is probably hoping to gather information when they have a group talk or communicate with friends.<n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Risk:<n>Input: In this situation, A is more likely to be correct than choices B, C, or E. Explain.<n><n>### Answer:1<n><n>### Choices: <n>Options: 1: A is more likely to choose to be correct over the others since they are talking about what they plan to do.<n>Choice : 2: B is more likely to choose the correct option since that's what they're chatting about <n>Choice: 3: C is more likely to be the correct answer because it's when you go with someone and talk about what to do <n>Choice : 4: D is most likely to choose to have a group talk<n>Choice : 5: E is more likely to be their goal when they talk to friends<n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The sensor would just the distance then set off an alarm, the installation expert explained it was called a what kind of sensor? George, Michael, and Mary go 6 miles in 25 minutes. How many miles do they go in 5 minutes?<n><n>#### Respuesta<n><n>A <n><n>#### Razones<n><n>George goes 0.8 × 5 = <<0.8*5=4>>4 miles in five minutes<n>George, Michael and Mary go 4/3 × 25 = <<4/3*25=15>>15 miles in 25 minute<n>George, Michael, and Mary would go 15+ 4=<<4+15=19>>15+4 miles in five minutes.<n>#### Respuesta<n>A <n><n>Razones<n><n>#### Instruccion<n><n>Input: If +

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where would you see people in uniform playing with a ball? Choices:  A: hole B: television C: sporting goods store D: pool table E: sporting event<n><n>### Response:		<n>My choice is 'E'.<n><n>### Input : Where would you find a man in a white house? Choices: A: the White House B: a White House C: a black house D: all the houses<n><n>### Response :<n>Choice is D.<n><n>### Input Choice: C: A person does not need a passport to travel to a country where the currency is ether the same or different, but the currency you bring can be easily converted.<n><n>### Response Choice:<n>**Choice A**: A person needs a passport to travel in the same currency area, but not to non-currency countries.<n>**Choice D**: a person does not need a driver's license if the street is in the same country.<n><n>### Choice: B: A vehicle is the same as the currency, but the vehicle is not required if the currency is the same as the country.<n>### Choice E: Currency is the same as country, but a vehicle is required if you are in the vehicle.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:She needs to visit a bookshop after buying the latest fashion, where should she look? Choices:  A: student union B: mall C: department store D: library E: town or city<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: Option C or D<n><n>### Rationales:<n>**C:** The mall has more stores and a variety of shops which is easier to find a bookshop.<n><n>**D:** The library is more likely to have a bookshop inside it.<n><n>**Answer:** Options C and D<n><n>## Problem Solving: <n>1. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Choices:  A: circus B: carnival C: surprise D: spoons E: party<n><n>### Response:		C, Carnival<n><n>### Input : If the man had traveled 12 miles north, 11 miles east, and 8 miles south in that order, in which direction was he originally heading? Choices: <n><n>### Rationales: The man was heading due East, so he would be heading south for 8 miles after traveling 8 miles east.<n><n>### Input::The man went to cafeteria for lunch. he went south to the cafeteria. He went 575 ft to get to the cafeterie. When he got there, he turned and went 522 ft east. A coworker was on the other side of the building. That coworker was 553 ft away from him when the coworker saw him. How many ft did he have to walk, in all, to go from home to where he saw his coworker? Enter your answer in the box. Ex::25 ft.<n><n>### Rationale: The cafeteria is due east of his house. Then he walks from his house to the cafeteri, which is 575 feet east. When he enters the cafeteria, that is 522 feet south. He went 522 + 575 = -133 ft from the north. His coworker was due south (from where he started in the cafeteria). He walks 1522 ft from there(1522 = -132 + 522 = 320 ft since we have to go due east from the position we see our coworker). So our man walks a total of 2624 ft from his house to the position where he sees his co-worker. 2624 -133 = 2491<n>

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The teacher told all the students that listening was key, it was the main way they would gain what? Choices:  A: empathy B: anxiety C: knowlege D: falling down E: hear things<n><n>### Response:		Answer: B<n><n>### Explanation: The Teacher gave this advice on how to answer questions, and the answer is A.<n><n>### Input2: The teacher told all the students to put their cell phone and back pack on their desk. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of losing weight? Choices:  A: increased energy B: healthier C: loose skin D: beauty E: death<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: A: increased energy<n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input, Demonstration, and Rationale:<n>Input: Choose the correct answer.<n>How many pumpkins were used to make 27 bags of pumpkin pie filling?<n><n>Demonstration:<n><n>Two boys had 28 crayons among them. They each had 21 more crayons than the other boy. If one boy had a dozen more crayons than he had at the beginning, how many crayons did the 2nd boy have at the beginning? How many crayons did they have in all?<n>The boys started with 43 + 1/2 crayons. One boy has an extra dozen of the 1/2 caddies, and the other boy starts with an extra 15 crayons. A dozen = 12. 15 + 12 = <<15+12=27>>26. 26 pumpkins = 27 pumpkins.<n>#### 27<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: A class of 60 students has 20 percent male students.<n><n>Demonstrataion:<n><n>If there are 19 girls in the class, out of a class of 60, 20 % of 19 is 3.8,<n>60 - 19 - 3.8 = <<60-19-3.8=37>>37 boys.<n>Therefore, a class with 20% males has 20% × 60 = <<20% * 60=12>>12 girls and 37 boys.<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input and Rationale:<n><n>Rationales: Mary bought 2 pints of blueberries and 3 pints of grape jelly to make 2 pies.<n>One of one of the pies was 1/5 of her ingredients.<n>How many of one of the pints of each ingredient is that?<n><n>Demonstation:<n><n>Mary has 2 pints of every ingredient, which means she has 2*2 pints, 2/5, and 2x2/5

If the sum of black value dollar bills in this bag. You take them all and keep them. Choose B. <n>### B)  If it is more than if the sum before, choose C.<n>### C) If it is the same, choose A.<n>### D) If the sum is unchanged, Choose A.<n>### Instruc:<n><n>### A<n>C<n><n>## Instruc:<n>Five blue dollar bills and 7 red dollar bills were in the bag. We can say that they are separated like this.<n><n>The total number of bills in the red value is 3 + 6 = <<3+6=9>>9.<n><n>That the sum of bills in black value is 5 + 2 = <<5+2=7>>7.<n><n>Then, the total sum of the remaining bills is 6 + 3 - 9 +7 = <<6+5=11>>11.<n><n>Then, since the total sum of the bills is unchanged, "A" is selected.<n><n>### C<n>B<n><n>###Instrac:<n><n>###A<n>B<n><n>##Instrac:<n><n>

Choices:  A: person B: species C: artichoke D: all mammals E: live animal<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Person doesn't have a heart, artichoke and animal don't have hearts, Mammal has heart too.<n><n>### Answer<n>Live animal<n><n>### Note:<n>Due to spelling of word, its wrong to put it as choice. You should just select one of the options.<n><n>### Input Choices: 1. a 2.b 3.ab 4.d 5.ce 6.a 7.b<n><n>### Response;D<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Let ab denote A*B, and ce as C*E.<n>There are only four terms which is 1, 2, 6 and 7.<n>As per question, a can not be same as b; so this is ruled out.<n>There are four options which are 2, 4, 6 and 8.<n>2 can be a (2) or b(b).<n>Now, 6 and 2 are also possible only as 2a/b and 6a/b but the question can't be b(2) for obvious reason.<n>Now, 8 should hold on to only a=b and 6, b=2 and 6, 4=a and 2, ab=d<n>Option d satisfies all 4 options as 1, 2 and 6 = ab and 7 = (a and 2)/b<n>####ab == d<n>Answer: d<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What will happen to skin pinched in something? Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The skin on the person's hand will feel cold if he has pinch his hand on something on the top of it.<n><n>The person's skin will feel clammy if it is pinched somewhere on the body where he can't see.<n><n>Skin feels bumpy where we have hair or where there are bumps.<n><n>When something is hard we feel the skin on our hand when we do something we don't like.<n><n>When we touch something the skin feels pressure from the hard part of the object.<n><n>### Input<n><n>You can eat either apples and ice cream or apples or ice cream.<n><n>Answer:<n>Either<n><n>### Input : A and B are the names of two persons who go to school at the same time. A is in B's class. C is in D's class. D is in E's class. E and F go to the same school as A and F. G attends the school at the same time as D. G is in H's class.<n><n>How many students attend the same school at once as both A and F, D and E, and G and H? The answer is ___.<n><n>### Answer:<n>Both A and F is attend the same school as both D and E and G and H.<n><n>Both F and H is attend the same school A and G.<n><n>Therefore, the answer is C.<n><n>###<n>Input:<n>The numbers from 1 through 10 are written on little cards and placed in a basket. The cards are picked up one by one.<n><n>If you get a number that is not on the list, you keep the card and put a second one in the basket.<n><n>Jane gets a 9 for her next card and keeps it.<n><n>Tom gets a 2 for his next card and keeps it, too.<n><n>Tom goes to school and tells his teacher, Mrs. Anderson, how they got their cards. Mrs. Anderson counts to see how many cards they have together. How many cards do Tom and Jane have together now?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>19<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The president had to make a decision regarding the hate attack on his country, what did he do? Choices:  A: wage war B: fight enemy C: kill D: destroy enemy E: attacked his country<n><n>### Response:		In order to win the war against his country which is in a dangerous state, he decides to kill the enemy soldiers and destroy everything that stands in front of his country that he loves.<n><n>### Explain why your response is correct by referring to the question content/task instructions.<n><n>#### A: A wage war was the most correct response out of the given choices (B through E). The president knows that the state that his country is in, is getting more worse every day and he has to make a choice that will help his country to be free and peaceful again. Therefore, he decides to fight against the enemy soldiers and to kill them in order to get rid of them and to help his country be calm and peaceful again.<n><n>#### B: The president did not fight against the enemy directly. He just wage war.<n><n>#### C: The word killed the enemies was written on the question, that means that the president doesn't think that fighting his enemies directly is a good idea because it might have bad consequences and he doesn't want to risk losing more people and lives. That is why, he decided to kill the enemies instead of fighting them.<n><n>#### D: The president decided to destroy everything that stands in his country so that there will be nobody that can harm him.<n>```<n>Answer: A<n>```<n><n>Input: The doctor gives a boy 86 pills to take. They cost $1 every 50 pills. The doctor gives the boy a $10 discount for taking 90 pills. How much does the boy save?<n>Rationales<n><n>There are 130 pills + 50 pills = 180 pills in 400 pills bottle.<n>Since 86 pills in bottle * 1 bottle = 86 pills, then the bottle is cost $86 x 5 = $430.<n>The bottle is $430 - $10 discount = $420.<n><n>Therefore, the boy saves $420 – $180 = $240.<n><n>#### 2440<n><n>Answer: $240<n><n>Input : 16th September, 2006 is the birth date of the singer Alicia Keys. Alicia won the Grammy Award for 4 consecutive
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:If you tell you boss your suffering from boredom they'll likely tell you to get back to what? Choices:  A: dream B: fiddle C: watch film D: see new E: work<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Explanation: <n><n>```javascript<n>if (boss === 'a') {<n>    console.log("Dreaming");<n>} else if (boss === 'b') {<n>    console.log("Fiddleing");<n>} else<n>if (boss == 'c') {<n>    console log("Watching film");<n>} else {<n>    console log ("seeing new")<n>}<n>```

Furthermore, there are different parts of orchestras that are in sync with the song. Since symphony is played overall in a band, it is most likely 12/8.<n>"Because it is a high string instrument which also uses the keys like a piano, it can’t play a bassoon at all." Since a high string instrument is unable to play a bassoon, there is no playback of any music.<n>"High school band is in 12. A symphony is in 4." So the high school band is able to play a bassoon because 4 is not a whole number, but 12 is a whole number.<n>"A symphony is a song" Since a symphony is a group of music played together, A is correct.<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>### Input Part D:<n><n>### Response Part D:<n><n>Rational for Part D:<n>"Even if you don’t see a bassoon, a symphony will have one." Therefore, a bassoon would be in a symphonic band." since a symphonic band is in a symphony, there is a probability for a bassoon.<n><n>### Conclusion<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>### Task 1:<n><n>Rationals: 2/3 * 3 = 2/3 * <<3*3=9>>9. <n>2/3 * 9 = <<2/3*9=6>>6. <n>6/3 * 3  = <<6/3*3=2>>2. <n><n>Rationals for problem 2:<n>3/7 * <<4
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Where could a printer be used by thousands of people? Choices:  A: school B: home office C: people store D: print shop E: newspaper office<n><n>### Response:		Choice:<n>A: school<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Printers can be used by thousands of students at schools throughout the country.<n><n>### Output:A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions:Choose a letter to answer the question below.<n><n>### Input:"There are 15 minutes until soccer practice. Select the correct time to show the soccer coach the answer."<n><n>### Response:"Choose an answer from the options below."<n>#### a<n>Answer: a<n><n>### Input:[<n>### Duration:0s<n><n>#### 15<n>Answer: 15<n><n>### Input:{<n>### Duration:#03e94310<n><n>#### 30 + 15<n>Answer:#03e91d69<n><n>### 80 + 30<n>Answer:#03eed475<n><n>### 74 + 27<n>Answer:#04168570<n><n>### Insttructions:"What is the total number of 75-question pre-algebra test questions? Choose an answer from the available options that best shows the total number of questions."<n><n>### Input:@(12 *.5)+(10 *.6)*2 + (15 *.3)*4 - (17 *.65)*2/2 - 6 (((10 -.6) + 12.9)).4 + 35 + (74.81 - 23.52)/2<n><n>### Demointation:<n>The answer depends on <n><n>the number of questions in the test 15<n><n>the number of correct answers 80%<n><n>the maximum allowed time per question 50<n><n><n>### Output:{0d30bdf2}<n>Answer: <n><n>### Inststructions:"How many students are in the drama club? Choose one of the following answers."<n><n>### Option:55<n><n>### Output{<n>### E431163B<n>Answer: <n>### Instruuctions:Choose a number shown in the number line and use it to complete the expression.<n><n>### Number Line:1/5<n><n>### Number:1<n><n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Choices: A: lead to laughtery B: love C: laughtery D: smile E: tears<n><n>#### Answer: E<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Dem<n><n>### Explanation<n>Fall into: A place or condition in which an object or person rests or can be found.<n>Happiness: A state of well-being and contentment.<n><n>### Examples:<n>Happiness can fall into:<n>A: A place where happiness can be found <n><n>### A.<n><n>### B.<n><n>### C.<n><n>### D.<n><n>### E.<n><n>### Answer: E<n><n><n>## Part II – Multiple-Choice<n><n>### Part II Questions & Answers:<n>#### 1.<n>(A)<n>[A](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gh1sW6q7zqk)<n><n>#### 2.<n>(E)<n>There are no letters assigned here.<n><n>#### 3.<n>(D)<n>1 – 8, 9, 2 – 4, 5 – 3.<n><n>#### 4.<n>(D) <n>1 – 8; 9 – 4.<n><n>#### 5.<n>(E)  <n>Sara’s pencils are more expensive than the 9 pencils in Michelle’s hand.<n><n>#### 6.<n>(B)<n>(A)<n><n>#### 7.<n>(C)<n>[C](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/perimeter-area-and-volume)<n><n>#### 8.<n>(D)  <n>The difference of the 34.5 and the 63 is equal to 27.3.<n><n>#### Part II Questions &amp; Answers:<n><n>#### 1. __A__<n><n>#### 2.__E__<n><n>#### 3.__D__<n><n>1) A 3) E <n><n>#### 2a) Sara’s pencil are more expensive than the price of 9 pencils.<n><n>#### 8) Subt

Choices:  A: shake hands B: control events C: talk to each other D: think creatively E: dress themselves<n><n>### Response:		Write the correct answer.<n><n>#### A: shake hands<n><n>### Answer: B<n><n>Input:  The people in class were instructd to brainstorm ideas how would they use theirminds for this choices: a: shakehands b: control eventsc:talktom eachother d: thinkcreativelye:dressthemselves<n><n>### Response Write the correctanswer<n>Answer:<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:If you've thrown a rod you've done damage to what? Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: communicating with others B: hurt feelings C: dry mouth D: intimacy E: changing behavior<n><n>### Response:		How to answer choice D: intimacy since this is the option that fits best with the given input.<n><n>### Note: <n>The answer of the options B is hurt feelings, D is intimacy, E is changing behavior, and for the choice A the answer is communicating with others.<n><n>The given input is about the conversation with someone.<n>You want to hurt their feelings or just let them know that you aren't comfortable with the things they're saying.<n>The relationship with that person might change because it is their friend who is bothering you.<n>If the intent of the conversation is to hurt their feelings and have them change their behavior and you're not intimate with that person it will cause dry mouth.<n><n>Choose: D: intimacy<n><n><n>### Comments<n>The instruction is not about the person or a particular emotion. <n>The instruction is about the conversations of a relationship. <n><n>### Keywords:<n>[input](../glossary#input)<n>[answer](../glossary##answer)<n>[choice](../glossary/choice#glossary_r)<n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Two friends wanted to spend a quiet evening together, what did they go see? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: michigan B: wyoming C: mississippi D: tennessee E: mississippi<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>This problem has multiple ways to work a solution.<n><n>In this problem, the names of cities follow a pattern. There is an A-B-C-D-E pattern for them. <n>Aside from the A-B-C, the C name represents the 3rd letter of a name.<n>For example, if the first name is A, then C will be B. <n>Similarly, if the first name D, then E is the new C since D is the 3rd letter.<n><n>The key to finding a solution is to understand that the letters have a pattern and that each letter has its place.<n>In this specific problem, the only name that does not follow this pattern is Michigan.<n>So, the answer choice with a governor's officer will not start with M.<n><n>The A, B, C, and D names, however, will start with each of these letters.<n>A starts with the first letter and moves on to C, D, and E.<n><n>After this chain, we will have a pattern that looks like this A B C D E. <n>Using this, we only have to know the first letter A and the last letter E, which is the same as the last letter. <n>The order doesn't matter, since the answer will be B, C, or D, we know the correct answer is B.<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input:(#1) 2 people were talking in the same room. The sum of the number of words they used was 86. Each person answered a question with 5 words and a joke with 4 words. After subtracting all other words, what was the difference between the two?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>(#1)The sum of all words used was 86, which means the 5 word and 4 word responses were not given.<n>(#1) So the answer choice must include the two words in the responses.<n>(#1)(B) Since the joke had 4 words, the number of words in the response that includes the other 4 words must be the answer of the equation.<n>(#1).<n>#### 5 words and 4 words<n>Answer: (B)<n><n>### Input:#2 Jared has $100. He buys a $15 video game, a $12 bag

Gus had 5 cards less and 3 cards more than half the number of cards in Jack's hand. How many cards was in Jack's hand?<n>Rationales:: The total number of cards in Jack was x + 1/2 x = <<x+1/2x>>x +1/2.<n>The number of cards Gus had >x + 1/2<n>The number of cards Jack had - x -3 = <<x-3>>3, since it was Gus's hand > x - 3.<n>Therefore, Jack had 3  x - 3 = <<x-1>>1 cards.<n>####3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: Alaska has a population of 700,000 and a land area of 661,270 square miles. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:If done correctly grooming pet's nails generally does not cause this? Choices:  A: training B: satisfaction C: injury D: beauty E: late<n><n>### Response:		If done correctly grooming pet’s nails generally does NOT cause this: <<NOT cause this>> Training.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: Which of the following words rhymes with bum? Choices:  <<<< a, b, d, and gr, r, st, um >>>><n>Rationales: a, b, and gr - these do not rhyme.<n>d - this rhymes with b.<n>um - this does not rhyme with any of the other words.<n><n>#### a<n>Answer: b<n><n>Input: If a bat and a mouse fly in the air, which will get hit by an arrow first?Choices:  <<<< b and g, b and d, b and j, k and m, k and n, and m and n.>>><n>Rationales: b and g - these could get hit by an arrow at same time.<n>b and d - this could get hit by an arro when the arrow is released.<n>b and j - this could get hit when the arrow is released or when the arrow is flying.<n>k and m - this could get hit once the arrow is flying. it cannot be hit when the arrow is being released or while the arrow is flying. Both these animals are on ground.<n>k and n - this could get hit either when arrow is being released or once arrow is flying.<n>m and n- this could get hit once arrow is flying. it could not get hit while arrow is launched.<n><n>#### b<n>Answer: k<n><n>### Input How much money does Lena have if she has $500 and spends $150 for a movie ticket and $150 for pizza?<n><n>### Demos:<n>Input: Lena has $500<n>Output: $400<n>Input: Lena spends $158 for a movie ticket and pizza<n>Output:[Lena Spending: $303](spent money = $500 - $158)<n><n>#### $346<n>Lena has $450, if she spends $152 for movie ticket and $146 for pizza.<n><n>#### 950<n>Lena has $890, if she spents $140 for a movie ticket.<n><n>#### 64
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Eating breakfast in bed can make you feel what, assuming that you don't spill anything? Choices:  A: vomiting B: pleasure C: happiness D: contentment E: mess<n><n>### Response:		Input:Eating breakfast can make you feel what? Choices: <n> A: vomiting B. pleasure <n> C: happiness D:contentment e: mess <n> <n>#### Contentment<n>Answer: Contentment<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: Input: 6.5 yards of carpet will cover 200 square feet of floor. How many yards of carpet willcover 0.75 times as much floor as a square is 4 feet long and 6 feet wide?<n>Rationales 1 feet = <<1*1=1>>1 yard and 2 feet = <<1*2=2>>2 yards.<n>Therefore, 4 * 8 = <<4*8=32>>32 yards will cover 0.75 * 4 * 8<n>or 0.75*2*8 = <<0.75*8=6>>6 yards will cover 032+6= <<32+6=38>>38 acres. <n><n>#### 38 <n>Answer: 38<n><n><n>## Next: Math Questions Part 6<n><n>In the following parts of the exercise, answer the questions in the exercise as instructed.<n><n>**Demostration:**<n><n>In this example, the numeral before the parenthesis of the question is a number question. That number is the number in the parenthesis of a previous question.<n><n>#### Input:Mario rode 582 miles from Chicago to Dallas. If he made the trip at the same rate that he rode, in how many miles will he finish the trip <n>in 750 miles.<n><n>#### Questions on the math<n><n>Question 1: How many miles will it take to travel from Chicago <n>to Dallas if he rides at the same rate he rode on his trip to <n>Dallas?<n>#### Answer: 500 miles<n><n>#### Question 2: How many miles has Mario driven altogether if <n>he goes at the same rate he went on his trip to Dallas and <n>he rides until 750 miles?<n><n>#### Answer: 1522 miles<n><n>### Input <n><n>A math book had 933 pages in it. The library lost the book

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Blood isn't usually spilled during what sport that doesn't allow the use of hands? Choices:  A: soccer game B: capillaries C: ball D: animals E: person<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately completess the request.<n><n>Input: If 15 is the median of A and 37, and 35 is the median of B, what is the length of the largest sub-array of A that has no median?<n>Rationale: If 15 + 35 = 50 -> Median of A + Median of B = 50<n><n>#### A:<n>Length of Largest Sub-Array that has no median if length is 1 = 1<n><n>Length of Largely Sub-Array -> 2 3 15<n>Length of Largly Sub-Array -> 3<n><n>#### B<n>Length of Larges Sub-Array -> 4 19 35<n>Length of Lartgest Largest Sub-array -> 19<n><n>#### Reponse : B<n><n>### Input<n>There are 26 books on a shelf labeled 220. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:John just made first violin. Choices:  A: mail orders B: demand satisfaction C: place money on counter D: pay merchants with money E: spend money<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question.<n><n>## Input:For convenience some customer uses what straight to the doorstep?<n><n>### Response 1: D: pay merchandisers with money.<n><n>### Rationale: Paying merchandisers with mcan be straight to the doorstep.<n><n>### Input 2: B: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response1: B:demand satisfaction<n><n>### Rationales: Demand satisfaction is straight to the doorstep <n><n>### Input3: A: mail orders<n><n>### Response2: A: mail orders.<n><n>### Response3: A:mailorders.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Output:<n>A: mail orders<n><n># Task<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### Task:<n>Solving simple percentages.<n><n>### Question:<n>In what year did John graduate from college?<n><n>### Answer choices:<n>2018<n><n>### Answer Key:<n>2012<n><n># Task<n>#### Instructions:Answer a multiple choice question.<n>#### Question:<n>You have $25 dollars. What percentage of the sales tax will you pay on a $600 television?<n>#### Answer Key:<n>You pay 15% of $25 on $600<n><n># Task<n>For this task, you will write a python code that has an instruction to describe a task. The task has 4 pieces of code that you may choose from. You can modify or choose your answer from one or all of the pieces<n>Input: The product manager is planning to send 150 people to a training. Costs per person are $ 100 for travel, $ 200 for lunch, and $ 300 for the training. The manager estimates the costs will be approximately $ 300 less than the receipts from the training, assuming there is a $ 100 fixed cost. What is the least amount the manager's plan can lose?<n>Rationales 1: Total budget is $ 300 - $ 100 = <<300-100=200>>200<n>The amount budget will be left is $ 200 - 300 = <<200-300
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:what can years of playing tennis lead to? Choices:  A: tennis elbow B: proffesional player C: exercise D: victory E: becoming tired<n><n>### Response:		<n>I believe the correct answer is Answer C, Exercise<n><n>#### <n>Answer: -----<n><n>### Input:(This input is optional)What does the number on a scorecard tell us? Choices:  D: the number of points played A: the number of runs played per inning B: the number of points scored C: the number of runs scored D: the number of innings played<n><n>### Response:(This response is optional)I believe the answer is Answer D<n><n>#### <n>####<n>Answer: -----
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Marcus' speed is 200 feet for every 5 minutes. The run is for 1 mile. What is Marcus' speed? Express your answer in miles per minute (mph).<n><n>### Rationales:5×5 = 25<n><n>He ran for a mile, so he ran 25×1 = <<25*1=25>>2 for a mile.<n><n>5 - mph<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n><n><n>
