Choices:  A: downtown area B: container C: ocean floor D: the lost city of atlantis E: high school<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demotization:<n><n>### If the store is selling you the container: the store has a profit of $10 = 10/0.<n><n>### If you buy the container for a high school. the store has a profit 9/10.<n><n>Rationales:<n>The store gave each customer a profit $10/0 = <<10/0=-10>>-10 with the exception of those who bought the container for a high-school.<n>For these customers, the store loses $9/10 = <<9/10=-18>>-18 as they bought the container for a price lower than wholesale prices.<n>Therefore, if you buy the container for high school, you lose $18.<n>#### A.Answer: D.B.C.R.<n><n>Input: 8.4 gallons of water were divided among 24 pitchers. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:After eating a dinner of uncooked chicken, what was felt by the poor man? Choices:  A: indigestion B: died C: illness D: feel better E: throwing up<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Answer:D<n><n>### Demarestion:<n>Indigestion A = <<Indigestion>><n>Uncooked chicken x3<n>Died C = <<Died>><n>1<n>Illness D = <<D>><n>1<n>Throw up E = <<Throw Up>><n>1<n>Feel better E = <<Feel>><n>1<n><n>### Input<n>When the doctor gave John a prescription, she also gave him advice about medicines that he should consult a doctor for. What did the doctor tell him to consult about? Choices: A: infections B: side-effects C: dosage D: complications E: side-effects<n><n>### Response<n>### Demonstion<n>A: infections B = <<A>><n>Prescription gave John<n>D: complications D = <<D>> <n>complications when he took a medicine<n>E: side-effects E = <<E>><n>side effects of a medicine<n>Advice to consult <n>a doctor for A<n>The advice = <<A>><n>to consult for B<n><n>### Demonsation<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### A<n><n>### Response <n><n>### Dememonstion<n><n>### Answer <n><n>### B

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Samuel has 5 birds. Choices:  A: overpopulation B: birth C: presents D: propagation E: fun<n><n>### Response:		The response should describe which one is correct: A or E. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>The reproduction of life begins with new life by giving birth.<n><n>### Correct:<n>Choice A is correct.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Giving birth is the act of reproducing new life.<n><n>### Input : The answer comes from choosing which letter name begins with the same vowel sound. Choices: A. bumblebee B. caramel C. cherry D. cucumber E. dust F. egg<n><n>### Response : The answer should choose A. bumblebees or B. caramels. <n><n>## Demostration: <n>The word beginning with A is bumblebee since both words start with the sound of a. <n><n>## Answer :C<n><n>## Rationales : <n><n>## Input: A 2.5-gallon jug holds 24 cups. How many cups in 2.5 gallons?<n>## Response : <n>## Correct answer choice: 40 <n>## Demostrasion: <n>2.5 gallons = <<2.5 gallons>>2.5 cups/32 cups <n>2.5 * 32 = <<2.5*32=80>>80 cups <n>#### 40<n>## Answer : <n><n><n>## Input: What is 37 + 3 - 9?<n>## Response : Correct answer choice: 29 <n>## Demostarion:<n>First, we need 37 + 9 = <<37+9=46>> 46 + 3 = <<46+3=49>> <n>49 - 10 = <<49-10=39>> <n>We'll multiply to convert to a whole number 40 x 15 = <<40x15=600>> <n>600 - 225 = <<600-225=375>><n>375 - 277 = <<375-277=98>> <n>98 + 85 = <<98+85=183>> <n>Added the tens which make the answer <n>#### 4

Below is a true - false question.<n><n>## The answer to this question is...<n>##<n>## If the answer is a true then "true" is entered and in the blank provided the reason or explanation "why the answer is true" <n>## If the answer to this question is false then "false" is entered and in blank provided the reason or the explanation "why the answer false" <n>## Your explanation needs to include a sentence with at least 2 words with details to demonstrate that the answer is wrong and to explain why.<n><n><n>### The answer to this question "true-false" is... <n><n>## 2.The answer to this question is... <n><n>## Demonstration: <n>## 3.The answer to this Question is... <n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instractions:<n>Todays lesson you will learn to write a 10 word sentence. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Sam found a giant hole in the plain.  What might this hole be called? Choices:  A: hill B: gorge C: sandplain D: cliff E: mountain<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:Provide the missing digits for each equation.<n><n>### Input : \(b^2=64\)<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Input\(5^3 =36\)<n><n>### Instuctions:How else could you make \(5^3\) by combining the digits?<n><n>### Instractions:Provide at least 1 different way to make \(5^3=36\)<n><n>You might have already seen this problem.<n>```math<n>4^2+4^2 = 16^2<n>```<n>You can start out by getting a pattern and then create more of the same pattern.<n><n>In this case, we have 4^x and 4^2. Then 4*4= 16 which then has the square root.<n><n>`4^x +4^2 = 8^0`<n><n>```math<n>5^2 +5^5 = 258<n>```<n>This one may be a little easier.<n>```math<n>5 * 5*5 = 125<n>12 + 5*5*5 = 250<n>25 + 5*5 =258<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:After going for run you have a sense of what? Choices:  A: satisfaction B: flying C: sweating D: falling down E: trip<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demand:<n>Input: How many fewer hours did Jake sleep than Mike? A. 5 fewer hours B. 15 fewer hours C. 30 fewer hours D. 60 fewer hours<n>Rationales: Mike slept 8 more than Jake which is represented by (8+<number>). In the question, (8+<number>){5 } = 13<n>Since, 13 is not greater or lesser than 10, we can conclude that the only answer choice with correct operation is A.<n>#### 13<n>Answer: 13<n><n>Input: 2 +(3x+4) = <<2+(3x+4)=10>>10<n>Choices:  A: 2 B: 3 C: 6 D: 7 E: 9<n><n>### Response<n>Demand:<n>Input:<n> Choices: A:50 B:60 C:70 D:80 E:90<n><n>### Response D<n><n>### Demnand:<n>Input: 21. B. How much does Jill pay for all the coins?<n><n>##  Rationales:<n><n>### A:<n>Choice:3<n><n>Jill will pay 23 for a nickel<n>since <math>\frac{23}{21}=\frac{1}{6} </math><n>Jill will pay:<n>1) 13+13=26 cents for penny<n>2) 23*2=46 cents for nickel<n>3) 46*6=276 cents for dime<n>4) 276*(\frac{3}{4}) = 208 cents for quarter<n>So, total = 26+26+276+208=614 cents<n><n>### B<n>Choices:<n>4 times: 23*2 = 46<n><n>Lesser: 3 fewer is

A jail is not a house. An internet café might not be on the same street as a blacksmith's house. A bar might not be on the street of A, B, D, or E.<n><n>### Answer:<n>The options' codes are in the code column and the answers' answers are in the selected answer column.<n><n>### Input :<n>What is the perimeter of the box?<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>Perimeter = ________ <n><n>### Answer :<n><n>The box has a total perimeter of 86.<n><n>### RESPONSE :<n><n>The perimeter of a box is the distance around the outside of the box. The perimeter is 2 times the length of the top + 2 times the width + 2 times the length + 2 times the height, so…<n><n>### Input- 4x + y + 4 = 4y – x<n><n>### Racionales :<n><n>4y = 4 x  – 1-x x4y + 4 = x x4y + 1<n><n>### Answer- 6<n><n>### RANSOM :<n><n>Subtracting 2x from both sides of an equation yields…<n><n>### Code Input :<n>4x + y +4 = 4y- x <n><n>### RATIONALE :<n> <n>4x+4 = 4y, and (4x+4)/4=y<n><n>### Answer - 9 <n><n>### Input - a +1 <n>or 14 + -1<n><n>### Rationales -<n>1288 =-1 * (14+ 1)<n><n>### Answer= -14<n><n>### RATIOINALES:<n>14 = 14, 14 =-1, -1 = -14<n><n>\_\_ - 0 = -\_<n><n>### ANSWER :  -_<n><n>### EXPLANATION :<n><n>### Input 4x + 8 = x<n><n>### Response x = 4x+8/4=
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answers:<n>What are students trying to get better at as teachers?<n>C: Ask questions<n><n>What are teachers trying to accomplish?<n>A: Ask questions<n><n>How is this related to how students learn?<n>B: Become adults<n><n>What does a 5 have to do with how adults learn?<n>A: Further Education<n><n>### Input<n>Which animal is not a carnivore? Choices:  B: Dog C: Rabbit D: Cow E: Turtle<n><n>Answer: Rabbit since they eat grass and leafs not meat.<n><n>### Response<n><n>What is an example of a non-carnivore? What is an example of a carnivore<n>Rationales: Cow and pig are non-carnivores since they do not eat meat. Dog and tiger are carnivores since they eat meat.<n><n>What is the difference between an omnivore and a carnivore animal? Choices:  D: They eat just meat D: they eat meats that can be eaten only on one continent<n><n>### Input <n>Pamela has a set of 4 red and 3 yellow cups. Which is not a possible arrangement? B: Only 3 of the cups are different from the rest<n><n>### Response <n><n>There are 3 sets of 4 that can be chosen like {1, 3, 4, 5, 6}, {1, 2, 3, 5}, {1, 3}, and {2, 3,5}. So, the only one that is not possible is the 3 cup red arrangement.<n><n>### Input Which list of numbers is odd? Choices:  One: 72 Seven: 9 Three: 2 Ten: 62 Six: 25 Nine: 6<n><n>### Response The numbers that are odd are seven, nine, and six and the numbers two, three, and ten are even.<n><n>### Output <n><n>Two of the numbers are not even<n><n>### Input What are students looking for when planning events? Choices:  C: Decorations B: Activities D: Time E: Weather<n><n>### Response Decorations since it tells what the theme will be like but not what the activities will be like.

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:How can buildings like the Empire State building be described? Choices:  A: small B: underground C: high D: huge E: tall<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The Empire State building is tall,<n>It stands on top of New York City,<n>It was built in 1993,<n>It was the biggest building in the world in 1931,<n>The Empire State building has a view of the Big Bangle,<n>So it is high,<n>So A is correct.<n><n>#### Tall<n><n>Answer: Tall<n><n>### Input<n>A building is tall,<n>How can one describe a school? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Choices:  A: fire B: belong to C: winter storm D: face south E: burn down<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: Fire<n><n>### Rationale:John is stuck in the house because the smoke detectors went the off, which is an indication that the house was on fire. As we all know, fires are very hazardous, especially if someone is stuck inside the house.<n>```text<n>Dave’s house caught on fire for real last week. He was stuck in his house for an hour until the firefighters came to his rescue.<n>``` <n><n>### Input:-12<n><n>### Rationales:-12 means negative 12 with an exponent of. Therefore, 12 * negative_power=0.<n>```text<n>Let's do multiplication and division first.<n>-17 = 17*(-1) = 17/17 = 1<n><n>-21 = 21*(-1) = -21/1 = 21<n>```<n><n>### Input, Exponential Form:0.10000009664009 = 0.100 or 10<n><n>### Rationals:0.10 indicates that 10 one-tenths. Since we know that the decimal number represents the ratio 10/100, which is also 0.10. In other words, one tenth of 0.10 represents 0.10 in its exponential form<n><n>### Input:"100 100 1"<n><n>### Ratians:100 1 gives 100. 100. We can only start with a digit greater than zero when we enter the first digit.<n><n>### Example:-3<n><n>### Rations:To find the quotient: -3 divided by 4 yields 0 with a remainder of -3. To find the quotient: 0 divided by 6 equals -1 with a remainder of 0.<n><n>### Inspiration:-3 / 3 = -1<n><n>### Example:3,812<n><n>## Ratiuations:3,81,2 gives 3,812 The comma here indicates that it is read as 3,81, then 2<n><n>##

If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The gambler had been winning a lot, he wisely decided to what? Choices:  A: matchwinning B: cash in C: compete D: return E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The correct response is: <n>Answer:  C<n><n>Explaination of why it is correct  :  <n><n>The answer is "C," the gambler has been winning a lot of bets, so he was wise to cash it in<n><n>[source](https://discuss.codefellows.org/t/2022/169/rubriquerubric-problem-solving-pt3-grade-7-and-8)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What treatment might an old time doctor have tried to accomplish with leeches? Choices:  A: heart transplant B: distance himself C: perform surgery D: study medicine E: let blood<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>###<n><n>A: Heart transplant<n>B: Distance himself<n>C: Perform surgery<n>D: Study medicine<n>E: Let blood<n><n>#### 40<n>Answer: A<n>---<n>Input: A doctor, a dentist, and a plumber are to be interviewed on a panel. The doctor is 3 times more educated than the plumber. The dentist is twice as educated as the doctor and 8 times as educated as the plumber. How are they ranked in descending order in terms of their education? Give your answer in order.<n>Rationales: As already mentioned, the doctor is 3*2 = <<3*2=6>>6 times more educated than the dentist. The doctor is 6 times more educated than twice as educated as the dentist = 12 times more educated than the doctor. The dentist is 14 times more educated than the educated as the plumber = 14*8 = 112 = 24 times more educated as the plumber and this means the doctor is twice as educated as 112 = <<112>>24 times more educated than 8 times educated as the plumber - 24 = <<(8*24=192)>>8 times educated as 24th times more educated = 192 = 38 times more educated than the 8 xeducated as the plumber.<n><n>#### 43<n>Answer: A: <3, D:8, B:64, C: 192<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Direction: Read the following instruction and complete the requested task. To complete this request, use math language to complete the request.<n><n>Input: How many crayons are in 50 boxes?<n>Rationales:"How many" is the "math" language version of the phrase "What is the sum of". So, this is "What is the sum (or total) of 50 boxes?"<n>Since you can find the answer with addition, you would write out what the math is asking for:<n>50 +?<n><n>### Input:/answer 10<n><n>### Response/answer 10<n>#### 10<n>Answer: 0<n><n>### What is the best mathematical solution to the following problem<n>When we multiply 4.58 x -7.59, the answer is close to -37.<n>When we multiply 2.75 x -12.75, the answer is close -34.<n>The smallest of those two numbers is close to -34.<n><n>### Input/4.58 x (2.75)<n><n>### Input-4.58 x (-7.59)<n><n>### Response-4.58 ∗ (-7.59 )<n><n>### Response(4.58 ⋅ -7.59)

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Your teacher, Ms. Green, recently asked you to write an essay about the 1995 book Jurassic Park by Michael Crichton.<n><n>### Prompt:Ms. Green read your essay and loved it! In addition, she asked if you’d like to write a speech about the movie based on the novel. Do you accept and complete the speech below?<n><n>### Instructor:<n><n>Write a speech that Ms. Green may use to start a discussion about Jurassic Park.<n><n>### Suggested Response:Write a speech that begins something like this:<n><n>As I’ve mentioned, I’m here to talk to you about Jurassic Park, a movie based on the novel of the same name by Michael Crichton, a best-selling science-fiction author. What I’m going to share with you are some things I learned from the movie that I really like.<n><n>A movie should have all the elements necessary to tell its story, and this movie has them. The storyline, acting, sets, costumes, props, and special effects of this movie grab you, and they keep you involved in the characters, and the suspense and drama that occurs in the movie.<n><n>### The audience response to Jurassic Park was mixed. Do you agree? Why or why not?<n><n>### Demosration:<n><n><n>### Response:(Do not include the quote.)<n><n>### I liked Jurassic Park, and I’m going to tell you why.<n><n>### I’ll start by saying that this movie doesn’t rely on suspense alone to capture the audience. It relies on suspense, drama, mystery, comedy, and romance in the same way that this novel relied on multiple elements to tell a story.<n><n>### Although the movie and novel are fictional, some of the events are based on real-life events, or a combination of real-life events. For example, the theme song, called Jurassic Park, was

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:A person writes a check to a clerk, where does the clerk put them? So, purple x 2 = 2 pants.<n>- One pair is golden. So, golden x 2 = 1 pair. Therefore, the grandfather has 3 x {2 + 1} = 5 pants, all of them are different colors. 5<n><n>## Rationale:<n>Each one has exactly one pair of pants. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:A musician is most likely to perform a concerto for clarinet with what type of group? Choices:  A: music store B: orchestra C: jazz band D: rock band E: music studio<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>Input:The following question has more than one correct answer.<n><n>### Input A:What were the four main colonies? Choices: 1. Massachusetts, Connecticut, New Hampshire<n>2. Pennsylvania, Connecticut, New Jersey<n>3. Virginia, Massachusetts, Maryland<n>4. Rhode Island, Florida, New York<n><n>### Input B:The two words that describe a "sit-in" protest are: 1. "civil disobedience" 2. "busting" 3. "government" 4. "tour"<n><n>### Input C:The best known composer of film scores is: 1. John Williams<n>2. Stephen Spielberg<n>3. Elmo<n>4. Aaron Copland<n><n>### <n><n>### Answer:C<n><n>Input A:The four main colonies were Virginia, Massachusetts, Maryland, and New York.<n><n>Input B:The words that describe a "Sit-in" protest were "civil disobodience" or "sit-in".<n><n>Input C:The best known of the composers mentioned was John Williams.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer:3<n><n>### Input 1:How many blocks must you walk if you walk at half your normal pace? 1. 2 blocks 2. 22 blocks 3. 8 blocks 4. 16 blocks<n><n>### Input2:What part of a ship stays whereever the ship is going? 1. the rudder 2. the bow 3. the stern 4. the top deck<n><n>### Response 1:1 block(s)<n><n>### Response2:The bow.<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer:2 blocks<n><n>#### 10<n>Answer:16 blocks<n><n>####3<n>Answer:1 block<n><n>####4<n>Answer:4 block<n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What would you normally expect a cat to say? Choices:  A: see king B: hello C: meow D: drink water E: live many years<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choose answer D<n><n>### Answer:<n>The correct answer is 1.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The word'meow' is a cat's sound.<n><n>### Input 2:This is a very hard puzzle for a cat!<n><n>### Response 2:<n>Choose answer E<n><n>### Answer 2:<n>The correct answer E is 3.<n><n>### Answer Explanation:<n>Meaning of the puzzle "this is a very hard puzzel for cat" is that cats would be too stupid to solve the puzzle.<n><n>### Difficulty Rating:<n>This task is easy.<n><n>### Language Used:<n>This task requires simple sentence structure.

Multiple Choice Test - each correct answer is worth 1 point, and each error is worth -1 point.<n>2. Short-Answer Response Test - each correct response is worth 1 point and each error, missed word or wrong part of sentence is worth -1 point<n>3. Conversation Test - The question is worth 1 point. The response is worth 1 - 3 points. A well thought out conversation and appropriate response is worth the most and a response that does not follow any instruction or does not make sense and seems to make up some kind of response is worth -1 point

How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:Why is this person not listening to music? Choices:  A: fall asleep B: relaxation C: deafness D: bored E: calm<n><n>### Response:		What choice best describes how this person is feeling?<n>Rationales::A:fall asleep B:relaxation C:deafness D:bored E:calm<n><n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input:(1 + 2 + 3 +...) = 63 + 63 + 15 + 6 = 127<n>How many terms are in the sum? What are the terms in the sum?<n>Rationales:(1 + 2...+n) = n(1 + 2 +... + n -1)/(n-1)+1<n>127 = 63(1 + 2... + 126)/126+1<n>This is a triangle addition.<n>127 are in the sum with terms as 63,63, 2,...<n><n>#### 127+63=189<n>Answer: 189<n><n>### Input:-2x + 3(2x - 4) = -x +6<n>Rationales:-2x + 2x-4 = -x+6<n>2x = x+6<n>x+6 = 2x<n>2x = x<n>x =2<n><n><n>#### -2x + 3 (2x - 4)= -x+6<n>Answer: -2x+3*(2x-4)=-x+6<n><n>### Input:#1 + #1# = #1#<n>Rationales:1+x=x<n>#x# is equal to #1#.<n>#### #-1#<n>Answer: #1#<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. If the number of boys to be girls in a classroom is 5 to 3, find the number of girls.<n>Rationales: In a classroom with 5 boys and 3 girls, the number of girls in that classroom is 3, because it is represented by the ratio, 5:3.<n>The answer is 3.<n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: Sam has 4 times as many marbles as David. Peter has 16 marbles. How many marbles does Peter have?<n>Rationales:' Four times as many' is represented by 4:1.<n>In a ratio with a ratio of 4:1, add the two numbers together.<n>16 = <<16=4>>4 + 4 = 8.<n>8 is the number of marbles Peter has.<n>#### 8<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: A bus was driving north at 40 miles per hour until a car pulled onto the highway. The bus drove 60 miles. The bus was 40 miles away.  After another 20 miles, the bus was 20 miles from home again. How far was the bus from home at the start, and at the end?<n>Rationales<n><n>In the first 20 miles, since it took 20 miles for the bus to travel north, the speed was (60 miles) / 20 (miles) = <<60/20=3>>3 miles per hour.<n>Therefore, in the first 20 minutes, the bus traveled ((3 miles * ((40 miles / 60 miles))) = <<3*((40/60))=5/10>>5/10miles.<n><n>To see how far the bus was 25 miles from home at the start:<n><n>((3 miles per hour) x ((40/60) * 5/10))

After a group of eight had finished and split two oranges among themselves, how many options did the other 2 people now have to distribute the last 2 oranges?<n><n>Answer: After their split, 50 - 2 = <<50-2=48>> oranges remain.<n>Each has 48/10 = <<48/10=4.8>>4.8 oranges.<n>So, there's 4.8 x 2 = 9.6 oranges.<n>Therefore, when there was a group of 10, there were 50 oranges and when there was a group 8, there were 9 oranges remaining.<n><n>#### 9.6<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n>

Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		This is a trick question. The rainforest has many different trees, birds, plant life, and water. The monkey should be found in at least one of those. It could also choose to be found in the great outdoors since it is a forest-type area. The choice "zoo" is not correct because monkeys are wild creatures. The choice "tree tops" is not correct because the majority of monkeys live on the ground. The choice "rain forest" is correct because the monkey would be found on a branch or a tree stump in a rainforest.<n><n>### Input:(6) 17 and (8) 69 have the same number of digits. Choices: 1: Not at all 2: Sometimes 3: Sure, why not? 4: I doubt it 5: It depends<n><n>#### 4<n><n>### Question2:If a large ferret can sit on your lap, it is big enough to be in your trouser leg. True or false?<n><n>#### 2 <n>### Question3:If you put a ferret in your trouser leg, it will jump out and bite you. True or false? Answer<n><n>#### 2 : False<n><n>### Rationale: <n>* A large ferret on your lap, is big enough to be your trouser leg.<n><n>* To find out if a ferret likes to sit on your lap, first a way to put them in your lap.<n><n>* To put them in your lap, go to step 1.<n><n>* To go to step 1, go to step 2<n><n>* To go step 2, ask a ferret to sit on your lap.<n><n>The answer to the question is:  Yes, the ferret likes to go in your.<n><n>#### 4 <n>### Instruccions:Answer the following open answer questions.<n><n>## Response to question 1:What did you see first when looking at the pictures of ferrets? Choices:  D: 1 big 4 small ferrets; <n>C: 1 big 3 small ferrets and 1 ferret; B: 3 big 2 small ferrets; A: nothing <n><n>#### A: Nothing<n><n><n>## Instructions:Answer two sets of the following two problems.<n><n>### 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The animals weren't good at swimming, so it was hard for them to do what? Choices:  A: pass water B: bathe C: listen to each other D: feel pleasure E: reproduce asexually<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input:{<n><n><n><n>### Response:{<n><n>### The animals weren't able to do what? Choose all that are correct from the choices below. A: bath B: reproduce asexually C: listen to eachother, and, D: pass water<n><n>### Response{<n><n>### Answer:{<n><n>### Which best describes what happens in asexual reproduction? Choose all that apply from the choices below.<n><n>### Response<n><n>### A: A mother can make multiple clones of herself, then give birth, and, B: Both genes and chromosomes are split in two, and, C: a clone can exist as part of another genetic being, and, D: A clone can be used as genetic material for another one, or, E: A clone can use his or her chromosomes to generate a new cloning process.<n><n>### Answer<n><n><n>### Instructions:How many centigrams are there in 5000 grams?<n><n>### Instructed Solution:Answere 5000 g = 5 kg 000 g = <<5000>5000<<5000/50001>>1<<5000>>1<<50g>1<<50g>>1 <<50>>1<<5>>1<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>1g + 2g + 3g + 4g + 5g + 6g + 7g + 8g = 40g is 4000 grams, answer answer 1000000g<n><n><n><n>## Instructions:If x = 5 - y, what is the opposite of x?<n><n>## Instructed Solution:<n><n>### Demosration:<n><n><n>### Demosaition:<n><n><n>## Instuctions:In the diagram below, each rectangle represents a different area of a garden. What does the total area of the garden equal to?<n><n>## Instucted Solution:<n><n><n><n><n>## Demonstration:Answe:20+20+20=60<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. A scientist noticed that each mouse infected passed it on to a mouse that previously had the disease (a process called horizontal transmission). She realized they needed to take away the chance that the disease would spread to uninfected mice. What should a scientist do to stop the disease from spreading? Choices: A: close the windows B: burn all the infected mice C: give the sick, young mice the antibody D: remove the mice out of the room to cleanse the virus E: separate all the healthy mice (by putting them in quarantine)<n><n>### Response Text<n><n>### Rationales<n>Scientists realized that they need to separate all the healthy people and place them in quarantine to prevent the virus to spread.<n><n>#### <n><n>Answer:E

Choices:  A: telephone network B: freeway C: company D: wall E: airport<n><n>### Response:		Input:He needed to check the electrical connection in the<n>house, where did he look.<n><n>Choice: Choices: A: telephone network<n>B: freeway<n>C: company<n>D: wall<n>E: airport<n><n>Rationales:The network is a wire or a cable that carries signals.<n>So the choice is B: freeway<n><n>Input:Felix and Shani are playing a card game. Shani has twice as many cards in her hand as Felix. He has 17 more cards than Shani. How many cards does Shani have?<n>Rationales:-Felix has 17 more than Shani. That means Felix has more cards but not as many more. So Felix has 17 more.<n>-The way to find how many cards a player has is to subtract the number of cards from his hand from the number of cards in the stack and then subtract the number of cards Shani has to find out how many cards he has.<n>-If I have 50 cards and you give me more cards, I can have 57 cards. If I have 57 cards then I have 50 less than 57.<n>-50 less than 12=<<50-12=38>>38 cards<n>-So to find out how many card Felix has, we will add his hand(17) to the cards remaining by him(38). So the output is<n>    17+38=<<17+38>>108 cards.<n><n>Now how many cards Felix has is equal to 108 - 57 = <<108-57=51>>51 cards.<n>####51<n>Answer: 51<n><n>### Input:-You need to walk 1.2  kilometers, walk.5 mile, and then<n>travel 2 kilometers. Choices: A: B: C: D: e <n><n>### Response:-You need to walk and then travel<n><n>Choice: Choice: Choice(s): A: B: Choice: Choices: A, B or C<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:- You need to walk 1,2 kilometers, walk.2 mile, and<n>then travel 1.2 kilometers.<n><n>Answer:-You need to

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:We were having a canned food drive and I needed to pick up some contributions, where did I go? Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		A <n><n>### Instructions:<n>A. Choices 1 and 2 are synonyms, choose the antonym.<n><n>### Response Instructions:<n>Choose the antithesis by putting the letters A, C, E, D, and B in the box.<n>Rationales:<n><n>Choose the antonym since aisle is the synonym for cistern.<n><n><n>Cistern, tank<n>Aisle -><n><n>B. Choices 3 and 4 are synonyms, and 2 and 1 are synonyms, select the one word that is not a synonym.<n><n>### Rationales<n>To find a word that is not a homonym, pick the synonyms and mark the box containing the word that is not a true synonym.<n><n>Ask your teacher for details on these two steps if you wish to learn how to choose the answer.<n><n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Instrumental:<n>Instruments of measure, which is also called an instrument, are tools used to determine or calculate physical properties such as length, area, volume, and so on.<n><n>#### Example 1<n>Liquid measures use a standard measuring tool called a measuring cup, which comes in several sizes. The term unit of the measurement is usually the same as the unit of the unit used to measure the liquid's volume. Liquid measures can also have fluid ounces and milliliters as units of measure.<n><n>The measuring equipment used to measure liquids most often is a cup or glass that you can carry with you, a measuring jug, or a jar.<n><n>#### Example2<n>The liquid measures you use with these tools depend on the equipment. The cups, glasses, and measuring jugs are the most common liquid measures.<n><n>Sometimes you hear the term liquid measure used to describe the amount of liquid that a recipe needs to make something, especially something sweet like cupcakes. In this context, cup is the most popular unit of measurement.<n><n>#### Example3<n><n>A unit of measure must be chosen if liquid capacity is expressed. However, it is not clear how to select a standard unit of measure for the recipe.<n><n>The cup is the most popular of many different units of measure, even though liquid measurement units can be
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? No output is needed with this condition.

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:What is a place where you usually store dishes but not books? Choices:  A: apartment B: pantry C: table D: living room E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		The place where you usually store forks but not books is _________.<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input<n>How many times do you have to divide 1620 by 45 to get the number 37?<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Instructions: Find the difference?<n><n>### Direction: Answer the following questions.<n><n>### Multiple choice:<n><n>### Response<n>The difference for the given expression is <n><n>---<n> <n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:The helm is not something you wear on your head. Rather, it moves the masts on what? Choices:  A: sailing vessel B: paddleboat C: ship D: motorboat E: tugboat<n><n>### Response:		A: sailing vessel<n><n>### Input<n>The helm is not what you wear on your head, but it moves the masts.<n><n>### InputThe following number pattern shows the order of the digits in the numeral "854352981". Which number is missing?<n><n>### Input8 27<n><n>### Input5 32<n><n>### Input3 81<n><n>### Input4 35<n><n>### Input9 3512<n><n>### InstructionsComplete the table.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Rationales: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>#### 211<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Rationales: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Rationales: There are 10 x 3 = <<10*3=30>>30 green chairs.<n>The total number of blue and green chairs is 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40.<n>So, there are 40 - 13 = <<40-13=27>>27 white chairs.<n>Therefore, there are 40 +27 = <<40+27=67>>67 chairs in a classroom.<n>#### 67<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Rationales: 4.5 gallons = 4.5 * 8 pints = <<4.5*8=36>>36 pints<n>36/18 = <<36/18=2>>2 pints<n>Genevieve drank 2*3=<<2*3=6>>6 pints of coffee.<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Rationales: If Beatrix has 30 books, Alannah has 30 books + 20 books = <<30+20=50>>50 books.<n>Queen has 1/5 * 50 books = <<1/5*50=10>>10 more books than Alannah.<n>The total number of books Queen has is 50 books + 10 books = <<50+10=60>>60 books.<n>All three have 60 books + 50 books + 30 books = <<60+50+30=140>>140 books together<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Rationales: A bird eats 7 x 4 = <<7*4=28>>28 berries in 4 days.<n>So, 5 birds can eat 28 x 5 = <<28*5=140>>140 berries in 4 days.<n>#### 140<n>Answer: 140<n><n>### Input:John hated mosquitoes. It is a story that talks about the facts and details.<n><n>### Another difference is that the writing in a blog post is designed to inform.
